title: Been using it for one year, and it's not gotten any better - also, data hog
author: E. Orchard
comments: As a Prime member, I was so excited when this app came out - "free" music! However, this is one of the worst interfaces I've seen, and I'm pretty tech savvy. I've seen several updates made to the app, and each time, it doesn't get any better. I can't tell the difference between my music, music I've downloaded (but not paid for) and I have no idea if I'm streaming music or playing it off my phone. There's a cloud library and an offline library, but they seem to contain the same thing.I never really cared too much about this (whether I was streaming or playing my music "offline") until I started using the app again recently and noticed I was using a lot of data on my phone. I started clearing my statistics on my phone to see how much the Amazon Music app was using. On my trip to work, which is about 10 mins, if I listen to Amazon music, it uses about 25 - 45MB. By contrast, I fired up Pandora and for the same 10 mins, it used 2.5MB. That's a HUGE difference!Though the free music is great, and it seems to contain a lot of music I like, it's a data HOG if you're streaming and the interface is poor.

title: AMAZON PLEASE FIT IT, THIS COULD BE THE NEXT GREATEST PLAYER IF YOU DID!!
author: Kira S.
comments: Unable to repeat music on my Android devices. That being said, and with the low star count, this player is still my primary source of music since I don't have to illegally download anything and since by weird coincidence all my artists seem to offer their music for free on Prime. I emailed the developer about this issue just a moment ago, so I'll wait to see how that goes but if they manage to update the  player I'll modify this review. Rarely have I had it stop playing a song in the middle of playing (both wifi and data) so that's a plus.Pros: Kills the need to illegally download most music, gives recommendations on new artistsCons: Cannot repeat, app force-shutdowns constantly. For Windows 10, the interface keeps changing back to Albums instead of Artists (like, who the heck searches for music by ALBUM instead of ARTISTS??)

title: Works great! I'm using a brand called BEATS professional Bluetooth ...
author: St-Law Family
comments: Works great! I'm using a brand called BEATS professional Bluetooth head phones. Kind of expensive, but the S7/BEATS or MyTouch/ and Amazon Music has given me/us a huge selection plus the hundred CDs recorded on my Mustang "Shaker" Hard drive gives me miles of music!

title: Nice app to have
author: Dan D.
comments: good app to have on the tablet or phone if described yourself as a music lover. While sometimes it buffers for a short period of time, it is a good app.

title: another leaving customer.
author: Christine
comments: I used to love Amazon Music. Im so sad that it no longer works. It just locks up, and it takes forever to load the icons (Which aren't necessary). I just want to play my music quickly, not wait 10 minutes for all the icons to load and then have it crash, never getting to even listen to my music.  I only purchased music from Amazon bc it went directly to my player; guess I will stop all purchasing of music from Amazon now and just switch to ITunes. Sad.

title: WHY does this idiot app insist on putting downloaded music in DEVICE STORAGE?!
author: ScreechingSnake
comments: I have been using Amazon Prime Music on my PC since the service was announced. Having purchased a samsung Tab Pro 10.1 I was hppy to find my old friend Amazon Music available for Android. Iinstalled it, and once i figured how to download my favorite albums Iwas in hog heaven, until my tablet suddenly stopped being able to download anything.The idiot app was stashing all downloaded music in device storage, so my puny 16Gb of device storage ws all gone while my 64Gb of SD memory was sitting gloriously empty except for some pictures from the camera and some tunes I'd burned via USB from my PC, which went to sd memory as God intended. This behavior continued despite me moving the app to SD. Happily, bringing up the app's on-device list allowed me to easiy delet about 3Gb of music I didn't really need, so I was able to download a bit more stuff I really DID want with some room left over for apps and whatnot.Since the app cleverly hides the downloads from the outside world, I am unable to transfer the music to a less horrendously unreasonable location. GRRR! Since I spent a very long career as a software developer for a top flight skunk works, poory designed software makes me VERY angry, VERY angry INDEED! If it wasn't for this rabidly user hostile feechur, I'd have cheerfully given this this a 5 rating! I'll be transferring 20 gig or so of tunes from my PC to the SD chip - thank heaven Amazon Music is able to see and use such files.One other small quibble: unlike the PC version, there's no volume control in the app - you have to tweak the system volume. A small thing, but inconvenient.

title: Current location for downloads is not settable by the user: Amazon music can't be put on the external sd card.
author: P.M.
comments: I am disappointed because the app won't allow me to save music on external memory (micro sd card) - which limits/kills the Amazon Prime perk of downloading for offline listening!While you can transfer/put your own music from your PC to the external memory card, anything that comes through the Amazon Music app will only be stored in the main memory. In my case, my 8GB phone (Moto G LTE) will run out of space quite quickly.Athough my android Android 4.4.3 KitKat shows the move app option, it does not work!I am seriously looking into a different ecosystem which has an app that allows me to store music on the external micro SD (32 GB). I find the app only useful when streaming (wifi), although I have to say that, for this particular purpose, there are better (pay) options out there.

title: Takes over your phone!
author: Tom Ewald
comments: Nice to be able to download my free Amazon Prime Music, but at what a cost! OK, my headline is a little over the top, but is there ANY way to keep this idiotic app from looking at all the music on my phone that has nothing to do with Amazon? I have a LOT of other files, some music, some brain entrainment stuff, and this stupid app insists on listing it all, so it basically gets in the way of finding the Amazon stuff when I want to. I want the Amazon app to handle Amazon stuff, and leave my stuff alone.

title: Good but not great.
author: aimeeregina
comments: As a prime member the music selection is extensive but the app ends up crashing quite a bit or will take forever to upload. The app's updates have helped rectify the problems but the problems still exist.

title: Great App, but needs further growth
author: Blackcat
comments: I wish that storage for personal music wasn't restricted to 250 songs for free and up to 250k for $25/year. If there was a way to upload more legally purchased music to the cloud for playback, I would be sold. This aspect of personal music storage is a huge selling point for Amazon Prime Music versus online streaming services like Spotify and Pandora. Commercial free music is great, but I want to use the music that I already have. What I'd love to see is a way to sync or play music from the cloud that I've purchased elsewhere either via cd or digitally. I love the integration of auto rip for CD's purchased on amazon and that makes me purchase cds more frequently because of it.

title: I hate surfing through sixteen pages of music suggestions to find ...
author: JC
comments: Very difficult to use, needs much improvement!First of all every time I go on Amazon to buy MP3s I enter exactly what I'm looking for by song and artist.  I get several pages of results, most of which were not in my search parameter.  While I appreciate alternate suggestions I would prefer that they were last and not first.  I hate surfing through sixteen pages of music suggestions to find what I am looking for at the best possible price.2nd, some of the sample music is of poor quality, sounds like too much treble or like it is in a barrel.  Maybe this is just the websites player but I find that the more expensive the song the better it sounds on the sample player.  It's funny that the same song on five different albums can sound so different.3rd, now that I've spent an hour surfing for 10 songs I have the nightmare of checking out.  Amazon wants to make it so easy to check out (or get my money) that when I click buy they automatically charge the last debit card I used without my permission or without letting me review the card and charges first.  Now I've got a $50.00 service charge from my bank because I didn't have the cash on that card, it wasn't the card I wanted to use.  You can't change the way Amazon stores you payment information.  The only alternative is to go into your account after each transaction and delete your payment method, more time consuming.  And if you want to call Amazon to complain, good luck.  They don't have a phone number on the web site and it is unpublished.  To make it more confusing, when I switch to my account to change my payment method it takes my to Amazon Prime and then I cannot get back to Amazon Music.  The icon for my cart (amazon music cart) is gone.  So I click on the my cart icon and it says my cart is empty.  I finally figured out that I have to scroll through several tabs to get back to Amazon Music.4th Now that I've made my purchase and want to simply download my new music, it's not so simple.  I have to download their app (that I don't want) to get my music.  Once downloaded the app requires a short coarse on how to use it.  If you want to download your music to Windows Media Player then not so hard.  But if you want to copy it to your device then it's a multi step process.  The download app doesn't ask where I want my music saved nor does it tell me where it saved it.  After searching my hard drive I finally found my newly downloaded music, but in my download file.Why can't it be simple, enter what I want, click buy, enter my payment method and download, that simple.

title: Pure Garbage!
author: Electrorenfro
comments: Not only is the user interface on this a logistical nightmare, the core of this app is a resource hog. I'm running am 8-core 3ghz mac with 128gb ram and the app just freezes, then quits on startup, every time. Go ahead, open your activity monitor. Wow is right. How does an app this small use 158.4% of a 4K video rendering monster. How, just, uh...It just blows my mind that Amazon has produced such an epic P.O.S. Seriously, I can't imagine a company that sells music, failing in such epic proportion at producing a decent piece of software to manage and play music. How awful is the Amazon Fire? The Kindle? Echo? I don't know, why would I ever buy hardware from a company that can't write software to manage their own content. You shouldn't either. We, the consumers need to start making our collective voices heard by not buying into the failed ideas and policies of corporations based solely on greed and if complacency is to be considered, perhaps even sloth.

title: What a terrific addition to Amazon Prime!
author: codejester
comments: Amazon prime music released and as a paid and happy Pandora user, I was skeptical. Since I was already a Prime user as well, I gave Amazon a shot for a month. By the end of my personal test looking for music quality, variety and features like station streaming, I closed my Pandora account and haven't missed it much. While Pandora does a better job matching similar music in streaming stations, Amazon is on par in every other area I care about.

title: Garbage. Will never use again!
author: Richard Anthony
comments: This has got to be the absolute worst way to purchase and download music. If the goal was to make folks go thru silly unnecessary steps to download and find music, then mission accomplished. The folks who designed this nightmare need to be fired, asap! Do not recommend to anyone, unless they are your enemy.

title: DAVE STAMEY IS JUST GOOD STUFF!
author: Dr. Bob
comments: I got "hooked" on Dave Stamey's music, his poetry and his guitar. All fit together with his "cowboy voice." My wife and I saw him perform at a Cowboy Poetry Gathering in Golden, Colorado last year. We bought three of his CD's: (1) Come Ride With Me; (2) Twelve Mile Road; and (3) If Ihad a Horse. We both liked them so much that we ordered all his albums--but at the used prices; when you add in $3.99 shipping, the net cost of each album was less than the new one with Prime/free shipping.

title: Incomplete - needs explicit content controls!
author: LeftCoast20
comments: Really wish you could block explicit content...it's holding us back from buying a family membership. Please Amazon, allow users to block explicit lyrics like other music services so that us parents can enjoy Amazon Music as a family worry free - especially since I invested in having echo products throughout the house.

title: Frustrated, and poor support
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I am so frustrated with this app on iPhone.  I purchased my first album here today, instead of using iTunes, like I normally do, and I've spent 45 minutes of frustration trying to download my songs.  I went to the cloud library and saw my album after purchase, selected "Download" (which has now changed to "Downloaded," but when I go to my "Offline Library" they aren't there.  In fact, there is an automatic playlist for "Recently Downloaded Songs" and it's empty.  How do I view my queue?  I've spent quite a few time between Google and Amazon search trying to figure this out, and I'm SUPER ANNOYED!  I don't think I will ever buy an album on Amazon again.I was finally able to download the album through my computer, and use iTunes to transfer to my phone, but I'm so annoyed with this app on iPhone.  There needs to be a way to view your download queue, and see what, if any the problem is.

title: Bad Move Amazon, changing from fee for prime members to a yearly fee
author: Shawn F.
comments: Loved this app, especially since it came with Prime subscription,  But now that it cost $79/year to get the songs that were free (the free version does not have many songs and very few of the favorites i had).  I will now be removing this app and going to something else.

title: Goodbye Pandora!!
author: Scott in Texas
comments: Amazon music is like having a personal, infinite library of just sbout every song in existense with genre shuffle, direct search and NO commercials, no limits on how often you can switch tracks and no constant badgering to upgrade or buy something. Goodbye Pandora!!

title: Was better as Amazon mp3...but could be a 5 star
author: Neal V Summers
comments: It was a lot better when it was Amazon MP3,The side scroll is a nice touch. Wish it coulld go landscapeon tablets,when playing music show the yitles on the bottomwith large print option for someone like me who is visuallyimpaired in settings who can't see small print that would be aplus.the prime is pretty cool,but once you decline it that's it quit asking!...lollso when transfering my wmas,mp3's etc..it used to add yhem automatically,Now it acts remedial dosen't add without either signing outor clearing the cache itself plus clearing the data.All in all pretty decent,but needs to be for tablets and phones.We need the freedom back of buying amazon mp3s and putting themon our external microsd storage instead of cloud music!If these changes can be made I will give 5 stars

title: A very simple app that works very well!!
author: Jason C. Gares
comments: A very simple app that works very well on my Samsung Galaxy S6 Android phone. I HIGHLY recommend the app and service!!

title: Hate that you can't download music onto your device
author: Alan L Ruff
comments: Hate that you can't download music onto your device, instead are made to stream everything and use up your data. Quit using it.

title: Amazon Prime Music streaming service has improved
author: bc
comments: Update: Apr 28, 2015:  My review went from 2 stars to 4 because with the latest feature additions.  They added stations.  Pick a genre and play music.  No stupid play list.  The android app still lacks artist search in the station area.I have tried to like Amazon Prime Music streaming service.  This is my second time since its original release.  But it just lacks common sense features that other streaming services provide.Pro: One very nice feature that stands out above the others is AmazonÛªs x-ray.  Lyrics display during a song.Con: Amazon Prime is hard to use.  Everything is centered on either an Artist or a Play-List.  Where others like Pandora, Spotify, and etc have something called a Station.  A station is similar genre music.Search for an Artist in Amazon, you get a list of Singles and Albums for that Artist.  Now what?  Play one song and search again?  I personally never want to listen to more than one song of a given Artist.  I want Random.You can make your own Play Lists.  But that is just too completed to listen to random music of a genre.  You can select a preexisting Play List.  There are some nice preexisting lists.  But after x songs are done, and then you have to select another list.Pandora is still the simplest to use.

title: Dodgy
author: Phil (San Diego)
comments: If you use both PC and Android devices to stream music from your Amazon cloud, this Android app's limitation of 500 songs per playlist risks truncating large playlists that you have created in the more usable web interface. Twice in the past month or so my playlists have been truncated to this app's limit of 500 songs. I believe this may happen if you have the same playlist open - not even playing, just open - in the Android interface and in a PC interface. It's happened when I've had the web interface up, and it's happened when I had the Amazon Music desktop app up.The most recent update to this app seems to be crashing a lot, with different error codes each time. Exception 94, Exception 182. The newest version no longer displays song length, so if you have the single version, the album version, and the extended version, there's no telling how much time remains til the next track; the best you can do is re-edit the mp3 "title" tags on every song for which you have multiple versions.All Amazon Music interfaces - web, desktop, mobile - are exceptionally weak at library management. Updates and improvements are driven by populist demand, ensuring that app development will proceed as an ever-reducing concentric circle for a single constituency - those for whom the greatest feature add is "pictures of stuff". Although Amazon sells its Premium Cloud service with the promise that you can upload as many as 250,000 songs in addition to your Amazon mp3 purchases, the functionality reveals that Amazon's target audience resembles the kid on the bicycle on the web login page; a small collection of mp3s organized into playlists about as long as an album, or maybe even a box set.This is the Android app I use the most, more than the rest of the smartphone put together; I didn't really want a phone, I wanted an mp3 player. The unreliability of the Amazon Music app is disappointing. Life was better when Amazon didn't use this app to push its subscription streaming service. Sooner or later a developer will create a library management app that will be able to stream playlists from your Amazon cloud. I look forward to such alternatives.

title: DISAPPOINTING
author: John C. Haslett
comments: More problems than I need.

title: Limited Usability
author: Ann Decker
comments: Music files can only be downloaded to a mobile device, not to a desktop computer.And it's impossible to locate the files on the mobile device,so you can't move them to play them offline on a computer.I don't walk around with headphones glued to my ears, so having music on a mobile device is not my thing. And I don't want to have to go online whenever I want to listen to music from my computer.Amazon Prime Music is what it is, and nothing more. But it's not enough for me.

title: This has improved tremendously!
author: The Dude
comments: So I have been buying music through this for awhile because, let's face it Amazon often has better prices than Apple. However I have never really liked how this app works.Now we have the addition of Prime Music! Huzzah, the selection of songs is actually pretty nice, sadly you have to listen to it through this player. Which would be ok, but it is not like you can have it build dynamic playlists for you based on your musical preferences, also no function for rating music( not sure why Amazon does not easily provide this in their apps as this would seem obvious). I have been toying with Spotify considering if I want to spend my money on it or not, or maybe Google's streaming service. Amazon's players lack of features and usability does not do well to recommend their prime service. Luckily for them 2 day shipping is always what it is.Also the inability for 2 people to listen to Prime music at the same time is lame.*Update*The service is steadily improving, Would like to see the stations get added to the app as this would resolve an issue with it I have had for awhile. I would also like to see an Android Wear app for this to control playback.

title: What was once good is no more.
author: Matt
comments: Until the last update, this was my primary listening app. Most of the music I listen to is stored on my SD card (I have around 30 GB of music locally) and the app would play it just fine. Now since the update, it apparently won't read from the SD card (my other players still do, so I know they're there) and there is no way to direct it to look in specific locations.I will not upload my entire collection to stream as that would be a waste of data and the limitations on Amazon MP3 make that a non-option anyway. I like purchasing music on the app as the prices are usually better than the alternatives, but until they fix the app back to the way it was, I'll be downloading them to my computer, then transferring to my phone to use with a different app.Oh, the new interface blows as well.

title: Android app that isn't compatible with an Android phone...pointless, not worth wasting the time to download!
author: SharonHultman
comments: This is the sorriest excuse for a music app that I have ever seen!  According to Amazon, the Android version of the app is compatible with my Fire tablet, but strangely enough, not with my Android phone.  I am about to embark on a cruise trip, and wanted to have the music I purchased from Amazon to be available to put on my phone.  It's nice to have a little mood music in your stateroom.But even though I paid for the mp3s I want to download, I'm being told that I can't because my LG Android phone is apparently not compatible with the Android version of the app.In the words of our current Pres, "Very, very disappointing!"

title: If they cancelled it tomorrow I wouldn't shed a tear
author: Catherine Murphy
comments: It's okay but only as a secondary music solution for you. First of all, I was super disappointed that "free music" really meant "some free music". The promotions and even the website make it seem like Prime members have access to full library for free. But then you start searching for songs and see all these price tags. It's super confusing until you realize you only have access to an oddball conglomeration of tunes. Their categories are horrible. I mean, when I see Pop as a category I think it's going to be today's pop music - not Pop songs from decades past. There's no "today's hits" section, top 40, or anything like that. And don't get me started on the weird music collections they've assembled. Who are these people who put together playlists? Absolute rubbish. All that aside, if you want to hear some old Journey or AC/DC album in its entirety, you can do that, so there is some value to the service, although if they cancelled it tomorrow I wouldn't shed a tear. You could totally survive without this mediocre service.

title: Another great benifit of Amazon Prime membership.
author: Tommie Blanchard
comments: Works great for me, coupled with my wireless headphones I can listen to most any song anytime I want.just another great part of Amazon Prime!

title: BUGGY
author: jaxnavynuke
comments: I used this enough to know its poorly written, which I COULD live with until, the 250 song limit. I do not know how folks that live on their Cell phones do it.Thankfully I have tons of storage at home. I will still use Amazon S3, but this cloud drive is total bs. its really sad they can make you agree to an agreement they can change at anytime, but you cannot. So bye bye so called free player. I do understand they got hammered by the Music co lawyers, but all my mp3 are legal. Its not like amazon is storing a new copy, its called de duplication. They got the hard drive space and its costs them next to nothing. Now the Music co will get a cut, and amazon will too.later amazon, thanks for the so called 6 months of free storage.......

title: The worst app ever!
author: James M. Whaley
comments: Terrible app. The old Amazon app was much better. Difficult to check device before purchasing music to determine if I already own the song. Many songs purchased through Amazon do not indicate that it is already In Library resulting in purchasing the song twice.  Lately, songs purchased through the app appear in the app as on the device but not when using the Android Music Player.  I can only play newly purchased songs on the Amazon player which has a habit of locking up the phone when used with my Strava running app.  To unlock the phone I have to pull the battery.  All in all a terrible app.

title: Not Impressed!  Needs VAST improvements!
author: Okie girl
comments: First - I have a Galaxy 3 and use the android app.  The previous Amazon MP3 music app wasn't the best.  I had to turn it off by putting the screen on the song and clearing the queue, but once I figured that out, it was an okay app.  The new app that includes Prime is much worse.  It will not shut off at all!  I have to go to settings and sign out for it to stop running; therefore, I have to log in every time I want to use this app.  Also the free music is full of tribute bands.  Really Amazon?  I'm starting to think that the only thing good about Prime is the two day shipping.  My kindle only allows borrowing once a month, and it doesn't take that long to read a book.  I am NOT impressed Amazon!

title: Amazon mp3 Was Better
author: B. M. Ward
comments: I've had my galaxy 3 tab for about 5 months now, and had just gotten used to Amazon mp3, when they came up with this new app.  I'm sure the app has some nice features, which I haven't explored yet, but there is one thing fundamentally wrong with this new app, wich for me, makes it multiple times less functional than the old app.  That is it''s portrait only orientation.  Why is it so?  Because when trying to create playlists, I can't read an entire id tag because it's too long.  If you listen to classical music with the opus numbers at the end of the tag, you know what I mean.  Fix this, and all the other glitches, Amazon, and you get a 5.

title: Great app
author: Harold Hamblet
comments: Works great for transferring and playing your Amazon music to your android phone. Bonus: It's EASY to use.

title: The older orange player was excellent. The new blue one is absolutely horrible
author: Douglas Reitz
comments: The older orange player was excellent.  The new blue one is absolutely horrible.  It hangs after playing 1 or 2 songs.  Offline library cannot by used offline..like when on a flight (my primary use of this app) . It can play one song then hang...so you close it and try another... Some songs won't play at all.  Really wish I could get the old orange version back.  I really regret upgrading.  This is a review of Android version

title: Too hard to weed through the stations
author: Moonbeam
comments: First, I'll say that I really like the sheer volume of stations to choose from. No matter what mood I'm in, I'm pretty sure there's something to suit. That said, I can't easily find what I want! I would love it if I could first select a genre, then choose from the appropriate stations under that heading. It's just a real pain to scroll endlessly, trying to see what's what. And by the time you think, "oh, I'll go back to that one channel I saw", you've lost it.

title: The selection of music isn't bad, but all versions of the app are horrible
author: James
comments: The selection of music isn't bad, but all versions of the app are horrible. Editing playlists is a nightmare. There must be some way to reorder songs in a playlist that doesn't take hours, but I can't figure it out. It took me a day to figure out how to not use random order. There's no way to rate individual songs,ÛÜ and a song that you have one day can be removed from Amazon Prime the next day.If you are fine with someone else giving you playlists, and don't really want to create your own library and curate your own collection, this is okay. But when I hear a song I don't like, I want to get rid of it. When I hear a song I like, I want to mark it in some way to listen to it again. Amazon Prime Music is not for people like me.

title: The app not great but the media purchasing service is excellent
author: Mightymouse
comments: Don't like the app on my Galaxy S5  phone as it isn't as user friendly as using the ipod and itunes but its where I buy all of my music these days so it will have to do. Even using the app for PC it isn't  as intuitive as itunes. Have to get into too may screens to select stuff. Tunes get stuck in the play back too if its playing from the cloud so I just download to device to bypass the cloud. The service of Amazon Music with Prime is excellent. Quick downloads, great selection. Prime music doesn't always work. Give it a rest and try back another time and it may work.

title: Not impressed
author: simpleeRandom
comments: not a wide enough range of music genres especially with regards to suggested music based on what you search for. I love music and I tried it out and uninstalled it in the same day.

title: B Sides
author: D. Surprenant
comments: A way for Amazon to gouge more money out of your wallet. A lot o "B sides" for free but if you want the good stuff you'll have to pay $10 a month.

title: One Star
author: Howard Lisnoff
comments: This Amazon Prime music app for android phones shut down my Samsung Galaxy phone and had to be removed.

title: Not good enough for me since they could not tell me ...
author: REB352
comments: My complaint with this app is that once you launch the app there is no clear way to stop/exit/quit. I contacted their tech support about this issue and they claim that if you pause the app for long enough period of time it will eventually close. Not good enough for me since they could not tell me how much data it continues to suck up during that "eventually" time period. The best way to insure that it stops is go to the app manager and force stop. I just decided that was too much trouble and uninstalled.

title: Used to be great!  Now it crashes NON-STOP when not in use.
author: D. Arreola
comments: I used to love this app.  It was one of the major reasons I joined Prime.  But recently it crashes almost non-stop.  I was recently watching a video on youtube and 45 seconds in and the Amazon music app crashed 4 times!  It continually crashes when I'm on other apps as well.  Its so frustrating, I've finally just uninstalled it. This almost frustrates me to the point of canceling my Prime membership.  Please fix it!  I own an LG G3.

title: first thing I hate more than Google
author: Jim
comments: Congratulations.  This "new" version sucks so bad and is so invasive I hate it more than I hate Onstar and Google combined and I cant stand those POS apps.  Never thought I would find an app that sucks worse than most Google apps but congrats Amazon you did it.  Uninstalled and never looking back...

title: Top 3 music player with limited song catalog.
author: AJ Bankston
comments: Top 3 streaming music player. I use it daily. I just wish you didn't have to upgrade on top of prime to get all the songs.

title: I like how you can listen to vinyl records you bought ...
author: Cam
comments: I like how you can listen to vinyl records you bought in amazon music when you buy a record you get the free digital version _ÙÔÎ_ÙÀ

title: needs unnecessary permissions
author: Amazon Customer
comments: This app requires access to my private phone logs, phone call history, photos, accounts, starts on startup so that it always runs in the background. Is it really necessary for a mp3 store interface ? I chose not to install this app because of this.  It's basically just spyware at this point.

title: Wonderful edition to Prime!!!  Wonderful music app!!!  Such an unexpected value!
author: Classic Music and Book Lover
comments: Love this music app!  I am a lover of many different genres of music.  From 70's, Disco, Funk, Orchestra, Burt Bacharach, Easy Listening, Classic Rock, Tons of Christmas, etc. etc.  I previously used Pandora and I å¢å_ Radio.  Those are great apps; however, I found this to be so much better!  I bought the Prime membership at Christmas last year to save simply on shipping.  It was well worth it.  As a whim, I decided to try the music app.  I had no idea how much I would be able to access and download FREE music that I love!  I was quickly creating my own playlist.  I have created quite a library with so many different types of music.  I now listen in my car using my Iphone and listen at home using Kindle Fire HD or Iphone.  I think selecting and purchasing music is quick and easy.  I find all of the process easy.  The only warning is some songs that are free are "rerecorded" so watch for that and play samples before purchasing.  Those songs are the minority, but can happen.  If it does, it is easy to delete the song from my cloud or device. I really like creating custom playlist from my library.  It is a wonderful app!I am wondering why so many people have such negative reviews.  I haven't shared their experiences at all.  Perhaps it depends on so many factors such as devices, Wifi strength, etc. etc.  I have had a wonderful experience with it.My only fear is I am building a huge library and wonder if it will fill my device.I love the app!  I think it is well worth joining Prime if you do not already have a membership. I actually opened the app on my birthday as a whim.  Since that day, I feel that Prime is gifting me with more and more music.  I simply search for artist and songs.  Most of the time, there are free offering for most all music I love.  I am thrilled beyond words!Yes, I have purchased some music also.  I have found that many selections I like have a great price on the CD which also includes the MP3 download for free.  So I receive my CD in the mail and have my digital music on devices.  This is a great gift in itself.  I can save the CD as a gift for older family members who do not use digital devices and enjoy the music myself.You will find Prime Music a wonderful tool for listening, collecting, and organizing your music library.

title: Nice Music Selection, Poor & Frustrating User Interface
author: TheReubenator
comments: Great music selection available, but the user interface sucks. To delete an album from your library you have to delete EACH SONG 1 by 1! That's really bad by design IMHO. Why force users to waste time like that? Frustrating.

title: Updates to the app deletes content for all device playlists - forces streaming.
author: David Kerr-wilson
comments: I have and use this app daily.  But the last two updates wiped out my device playlists.  The playlist screen even has a little button to toggle between device and cloud.  worked until the updates.... rebuilt the playlist on the device.... today's update?  wiped out the playlist that was local.  I don't want to have to hook up to every strange wi-fi signal I can get to stream my music - I download and play.  Wiping out playlists is just wrong.

title: Great so far
author: Jamie M.
comments: Great so far, just need to make sure the songs are the actual artist songs not done by someone else

title: Eats data like it tastes good.
author: Foster
comments: I've been using one version or another of the Amazon Music Player app for the past three or so years.  I've generally been happy with it, found it fairly easy to navigate, and I'm not super tech savvy.  My biggest complaint was the need to change any of the .wma files on my computer to mp3 in order to import them to the cloud library simply because it's a pain in the rear (apparently my files couldn't be matched in the Amazon catalog...odd since some songs from an album would be matched and import while others from the same album wouldn't).  My second biggest complaint was that every time an update would come out, it would change the interface on my phone and I'd have to re-learn where everything was again.  But overall, manageable and fine.Then my phone recently updated to 4.0.4.Which has sucked.  I spent the extra money to import non-Amazon music, greatly expanded my library, and looked forward to the ease of use to which I had become accustomed.  I've found that since updating, my data use dedicated to this app has skyrocketed for no discernible reason.  I'm not a big data consumer.  My average data use over the past year or so doesn't usually exceed 200-250 mb in a month.  I'm on Wi-Fi more often than not (at home and at work, so I'm usually only streaming 3g/4g in the car).  Yesterday, I received an alert from my service provider that I'm close to exceeding my monthly data cap...this app has used over 700 mb of data.In 4 days.When I'm not using the app, I close it.  It restarts itself.  I close it again.  It restarts again.  And it apparently runs in the background ALL THE TIME despite my efforts to turn it off.  Top it off with an obscene amount of buffer time I've never had before, and I'm not just disappointed with the app.  I'm pretty well disgusted with it.  If I'm in my car, I can't fast-forward through a song without minutes worth of dead air because it's still buffering.  It sometimes even happens on Wi-Fi.I've now used my settings so that it will only stream on Wi-Fi.  Which renders it useless for long car trips...a purpose for which I've used it for some time with no prior issues.Given that I paid actual money to be able to use this with more of my personal library, I won't likely abandon it right off the bat.  I'll take the time to find something I like better, transfer my library (again), and move on.  In the meantime, I'm peeved because I need to manage what little data I have left carefully for the rest of the month and trust that this app won't just ignore my settings and keep running itself and eating my data.Sad for an app I've previously enjoyed and recommended to others.  That won't be happening again.

title: fix the basics!!
author: SMxoxSF
comments: look, Amazon--I am SO happy to have acces to my music via my mobile devices. the concept is excellent. the execution, however, needs some major improvement. please FIX the navigation and selection of music. I don't know if it's your Apple interface, but when I click on an album to play it, the app selects random songs from within the album. when I want to play all of an artists' music, same problem. the LAST thing I want to have to do EVERY TIME I go to play my music is fight with the app to get it to select the music I want--you know: the one I put my mouse over and clicked on. this is so basic, I cannot beleive it continues to be a problem. fix it, please, and I'll change to the max rating.

title: Okay app, but needs some simple improvements
author: Erik
comments: Their latest update makes the app harder to use.  I like the app overall - it easily lets me play music from my device or my cloud.  I really like the Prime Music, and you can even download Prime songs.  It's fairly easy to navigate and use, but I do have some complaints:-The app doesn't rotate with your phone.  When I listen to music at work, I usually have my phone charging, which means the phone is on its side (horizontal) - makes it hard to easily see and scroll through the app when it doesn't rotate with the orientation of the phone.-After the update to this app, it's crashed several times on my Galaxy S5 in the middle of a song...don't know why - just shuts itself down.-On the other hand, the app won't quit when I try to shut it down.  First off, there's no "sign out" or "exit program" in the main menu.  The only way I can easily find to quit the program is by dropping down my phone's menu of running applications (the quick menu), and there's a little x to close the Amazon Music app.  Only about 10% of the time does this x button work.  Sometimes it'll look like the app closes, but when I turn my phone off, then back on, the app is back on my home screen.  The only true way of completely closing this app and stopping it from running on my phone is by going to my phone's application manager and terminating the process for this app - that's a completely unacceptable means of closing an app, IMHO.-There's no option in Settings that prevents the screen from going to sleep.  Again, when listening to music at work, I like to keep my phone on and see what's playing easily skip through songs and choose what I want to listen to.  Unless I go to my phone settings and turn off the screen sleep option, the phone goes to sleep.  So every time I want to change songs, I have to wake the phone up, unlock it and change songs.-The only way you can see the time position of your song and the length of the song is by tapping the screen.  The time position and length of each song should be shown all the time (or at least give us the option to show it constantly)

title: More work than it is worth.
author: R.W.S.
comments: This used to be an intuitive and effective app.  At the last upgrade it forgot all of my non-amazon music, I had to redownload thousands of my amazon songs, and I have lost all of my play lists.More work than it is worth and I'm looking for a replacement.

title: Takes up too much of your phones storage, I ...
author: Vince F.
comments: Takes up too much of your phones storage, I understand of you don't own the music that it can't be installed on the SD card but the bulk of the files could, and the part of the file that allows playback could stay on the device storage, freeing up your device storage for other things.

title: So far, it seems to have a limited selection ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: So far, it seems to have a limited selection of "Free" music. If it was just a music service, I wouldn't expect much, but if seems to be promoted as part of "Prime", which I pay for. I expected a bigger selection of free music.... I guess it is what it is.....

title: I love it. It is well worth upgrading to Unlimited
author: Chris
comments: I love it. It is well worth upgrading to Unlimited, as well. Between having the app on my phone and my playlist at the ready...heaven to my ears!

title: Rip off
author: Lanky
comments: Kinda sucks.. paying 79.99 a year and can't even listen to almost half the band's I listen to without having to buy the albums.

title: Removed half the music I listen to
author: Kindle Customer
comments: Amazon unlimited subscription previously provided a good array of music and though it didn't have everything,  to me,  it was worth the subscription. I'm not sure what happened but almost half the songs in my playlist now are not included. I don't see the point to pay a fee to get almost nothing. I have unsubscribed.

title: Music Removals
author: Tammy W.
comments: I loved it and used it a lot. It has been awhile but when I went back to it yesterday, I found that many of my favorites were no longer available on it. One of the big reasons I have Prime is for the music so I was quite disappointed. I still love the app but really wish they wouldn't have removed so many of the albums I loved the most.

title: Frustrating, lackluster - I thought Amazon would be a leader for the cloud music experience.
author: chicvibe
comments: This app is incredibly frustrating, and the effectiveness varies by device.  I have it on two rokus, two pc's, my iphone, my ipad, and amazon fire.  1.  I am a super-user, in that I have over 80k songs in my cloud subscription (which says storage is for "up to 200,000" - yeah, I know, "up to", but it keeps accepting my songs).  I kept getting a message that my (PC version) library couldn't be loaded because it had over 40k songs.  2.  When I try to get in to my library, I get the black computer screen of death that says "ah fiddlesticks, if you continue to see this message, contact amazon".  I see that message so often, that I just don't even bother.  My cache is clear, my computer is up-to-date.  Tiresome.  3. Because of problem #1, I thought I would open a SECOND cloud to split my library.  Wellllllll... Now it tells me that my computer can only be associated with ONE cloud account.  This is just my experience with the PC version.  It works well with Roku, except that I do not get prime.  It works okay with the Fire, but the interface with either is somewhat clunky for a large library.  I am phasing out not only using this app, but purchasing digital music from Amazon.

title: Too cumbersome of an App.
author: Veronica Gill
comments: Takes up too much space in phone storage and uses up too much RaAM, cannot be shut down nor turned off neither. Kept crashing my phone even when it wasn't in use. Only thing good is that some music comes free with the App.

title: Overall good
author: sf
comments: It's nice to have stations with no ads and unlimited skips. Sometimes it has trouble loading, and sometimes what's on the stations doesn't correspond well to the name. For example, Dire Straits radio plays very little Dire Straits. Overall, though, it's great. I love having offline access to the music from CDs that I bought in the past. That was a pleasant surprise.

title: Good, but not great
author: Dan Fethkenher
comments: I don't like that if you close the app and come back to it later, it always defaults back to the original screen. I want it to default to what I was playing last, or the search screen. Also, they're a TON of music I want to listen to that's not on here :/  4 stars.

title: Amazon Prime Music app
author: Karen Lee
comments: Just bought a brand new LG G3 and first day updated my Prime Music library (done on my Kindles originally) with some new playlists.  The NEXT day, my phone was unable to open the pre-installed app without getting the following dialog box:  Amazon Music app has crashed.  I tried to uninstall (not able to without jeopardizing other apps.  I even tried going into the Amazon App store to download again, with same results.  Very disappointed if this app will not work on my new phone and also just realized it will not work on my 2nd generation Kindle Fire.

title: Wish the unlimited music was included with Prime membership.
author: Julia Chachere
comments: I am very happy with this app, tho I wish the music selection was bigger. Not very thrilled that you have to pay extra for the unlimited music even with a Prime membership.

title: Is there a way.......
author: Roger
comments: to give no stars.....this is such a poor app. I am really disappointed that Amazon would put out such a pathetic app. It simply does not work,and to top it off, it opens itself to portrait view, and there is no choice for landscape view,what the hell.

title: Terrible!!!!
author: Fred O.
comments: First of all, it is the most user friendly-less app I have encountered to date. I can not figure out how to navigate within the app and I don't want to since there are easier apps to manage such as Pandora. I had a subscription before I discovered Amazon Prime Music and thought that since I am paying for Amazon Prime, why bother with Pandora. Well, the answer is that it is worth the $5/mo. for Pandora since it is so much cheaper  since frustration is very expensive.

title: Inability to share digital content with household drives me away
author: zi
comments: Inability to share prime access with household drove me into google's arms. I have no idea why Amazon doesn't let me share digital content with my wife the way they do with prime shopping.I would be Amazon all the way for movies, music, audio books, etc if this were true. But I'm not paying another $100 for my own prime account and having all my digital content segregated from my wife's account.

title: Well-done welcome addition to Prime offerings!
author: Jerswing
comments: Welcome addition to Prime offerings.Gorgeous, well designed App on Windows computer; Android App is merely adequate/functional.Limited selection of my favorite artists, but the Playlists are diverse & generally well-programmed.Playlists have provided access to a few new Track/Artist discoveries ... and, equally important, Tracks of interest which can be added to Music library.Especially appreciate ability to download Tracks/Playlists to portable devices for offline listening (I have Wi-Fi only Android tablets)Only wish someone at Amazon could explain how to download/install Prime Music App to older (but qualified) Android tab.

title: Absolutely horrible user interface and Widget is useless
author: L. Casey
comments: I keep hoping that Amazon will get serious about their music offering but at this point I will not be renewing. The only positive thing is the integration with Echo. In Android, the interface is not user friendly. It's way too many clicks to get to your playlists and the ui is not intuitive. The thing that upsets me the most is their android widget. It's useless and bad never been updated. Other music services have widgets for direct playing of radio stations, playlists, etc. Amazon please play catch up and take this service seriously. I love Amazon but the music service applications are worthless and incredibly frustrating.

title: Countdown to cancelling Prime membership
author: Drew
comments: I hate writing reviews, especially negative, but IÛªm to the point where it doesn't make sense to keep maintaining my Prime membership.  I will never own an Amazon Android branded device and attempting to use my Prime membership with my Android devices is the ultimate act in frustration.Amazon, why canÛªt I sync playlist?.  It was bad enough with previous Android app (playlist would never sync and required downloading whenever change on cloud or vice versa) but NOW no option to sync playlistsÛ_REALLY!So, with no hope of ever having android player for my video purchases and Prime membership, less than zero chance or Chromecast support and now the stripping of your measly convenience features for Android, I will not only be cancelling my membership but making it a point to convince family and friends to cancel theirs as wellÛ_Disgusting.

title: Clunky, unintuitive, frustrating
author: Marcus W. Hambright
comments: I tried using it when it first came out and it was so clunky and unintuitive that I've only been using it as a downloader since - and downloading music through this app is an awful experience every single time.  It almost always wants me to re-download and reinstall the app when I buy digital music, and when it reinstalls I often have to restart the app several times for it to recognize that I have purchased music and would please like to download the music.  A while ago, before amazon forced me into using this app to download their music, I used to buy so much more music, but now that the experience is so consistently frustrating, I wait until there are at least a few items for me to buy and I just stopped impulse buying music altogether.  I do like the color orange and think that white text works quite well on an orange background, so the app does have that one good thing going for it, but that's the only good thing I can think of.

title: Downloads, but won't install!
author: Curt J. Huffman
comments: Can't even use it anymore. It says there's an update. Downloads the update. But hangs when you try to install it.

title: Watch out for autoplaying Prime stations from notification "There is an Amazon Station we think you'll LOVE"
author: Polly L. Mccall
comments: I got a notification today - "There is an Amazon Station we think you'll love!" - I made the FATAL mistake of clicking on that notification. The station (NOT one I LOVE, for what it's worth - nice algorithm, guys) immediately started PLAYING! when I did not have my headphones in. NOPE! Do NOT ever autoplay ANYTHING without warning. That was embarrassing and disruptive. SHOW me the station, sure. Do NOT autoplay it.And wow, what ever made you think I would LOVE some Elton John right about now.

title: If it's free streaming, im lost at sea!
author: Christopher T.
comments: I couldn't find any original artists' versions of songs to stream for free. Only cover bands and their versions. Everything original was for sale, not for free stream.

title: Tired of needing helo
author: jeff campbell
comments: I give it one only getting that one because it worked so welll on my htc phone. But now im with boost mobile wich i understand is part of Sprint. Everytime i download the app for Android when I open it it says get amazon music  application for Android and ruound and round we go so I'll just forget it and go to pandora and i iheart radio. Heck the worst part is that im a prime member. I guess that doesn't mean  much anymore.

title: If you're a Prime member, you should be...
author: ju
comments: Many friends of mine who are Prime members aren't aware of how awesome Prime music is. They think it's like Pandora. It's like Padora ON STEROIDS! What's not to like? New artists being added all the time, just released albums being added all the time...I love prime music. Got even better with my Echo Dot. I can change genres, advance songs, go to playlists just by asking Alexa.

title: Songs cut out
author: Elliott Nunez
comments: After downloading songs they sometimes just stop playing. The whole song doesn't get downloaded. This has happened on several songs. I don't know if redownloading will help or not. Song selections could be better. Certain songs you have to pay extra for. You're already paying for music then you search for certain songs and you've gotta pay more.If it was new music I could understand but some songs are 20 years old. There are also a lot of good songs included too. That's why I rated 3 stars.I would've rated 5 stars if slot more songs were included at no extra charge. Another star deducted because of the download issue.

title: Even adding playlists is an annoying chore because when I drag the song over the ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: The interface on PC moves around. Even adding playlists is an annoying chore because when I drag the song over the playlist, the playlist *moves* out from underneath my mouse. I have to chase the playlist around the screen. The music selection is also.... not great.

title: Finally Have My Music!
author: InHymn
comments: I had purchased several CD's from Amazon and thought to myself, Why carry and ipod and my Samsung Galaxy S5. I also wondered who I could call to help me transfer my music from my computer to my S5. Well when I purchased my last CD from Amazon it asked me about using Amazon Music, since I already had Amazon Prime. It did it all for me! Quickly and easily. It loaded all of my purchased CD's and music from Amazon into my new Amazon Music account. Then searched my computer, by request, for my iTunes music. Downloaded the app for Amazon Music to my phone. I checked my phone and it was all there. I can't believe the time I spent without my music on my phone and I could have had it all along! Amazon Prime was the best. But now with Amazon Music it is the greatest. Thank you Amazon!!!

title: Five Stars
author: Jimbob
comments: Works much better on my android cell than the other two and no annoying commercials.

title: Great value!
author: Eric
comments: I tell everyone who will listen Amazon prime is the best value anywhere and Amazon music is part of that. You can download a TON of music to your device and listen to it without eating up your data. Perfect for when I'm at the gym with no WiFi and still want a great selection. Download all you can and listen later! Though you only can listen via amazon music player it's more than enough for me.

title: Prime music has better radio and lists than Spotify
author: Penano
comments: IMO Prime music has better lists than Spotify and radio stations. I haven't experienced a repeated song in the radio stations, and new cool stations are suggested very often using the power of math. That's nice. The only issue is that I think that the library is not as huge as spotify which may be a problem if you look for specific songs very often.

title: Not good
author: stevo
comments: Not so great anymore. All the songs I have yet to download that were free for prime members now cost extra $.

title: ... the music I am looking for and I really like the off line library how ever music does take ...
author: holly tulgestke
comments: I would give this 5 star's Because I can find all the music I am looking for and I really like the off line library how ever music does take alot of room on your device and I have not figured a way to put it on my SD card I have had to delete most of my library off my tablet because the music took up so much of my memory I was not able to even receive emails this is the reason for only three star's

title: Five Stars
author: Patsy Glaser Gibson
comments: I really like the selection. I'm just learning how to download and build my playlist. It's new to me.

title: Great! All Around..Very Pleased, Very Happy..Peter and Family, USA..God Bless...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Great! All Around..Very Pleased, Very Happy..Peter and Family, USA..God Bless...

title: I love ALL kinds of music
author: Blue Tiger
comments: I love ALL kinds of music. I listen to music almost all day long. I like having a variety of music and change what I listen to based on what I am feeling at the moment or what I am doing, or need to do. Prime music allows me to an almost unlimited choice of music without having to pay for every single song or album. If you like to listen to different music genres and don't want to pay a bunch of money to have it then give Prime music a try.

title: Needs a few simple but vital improvements
author: Stephen C. Innamarato
comments: I like the fact that I get to listen to music comercial free with my Prime Membership but the app needs a few vital improvements to get a 5 star rating.  1.) When clicking thumbs down, I wish it gave the option to  permanently exclude the artist from my station.  I don't like Nickleback and I keep pressing thumbs down only to have another Nickleback song play later on.  2.)  When creating Playlists, I wish it the had the capability of slecting songs from your cloud library AND your offline library for the same playlist.  3.) My favorite station  never stays up top and sometimes I have to search for the station I was listening to an hour ago.  Can we "favorite" stations and create a list?  4.) When listening to stations, I often will hear the same songs over and over within an hour or two but yet songs I hit the tumbs up for could take days until I hear them again.  That's just baffling!

title: quite buggy
author: Kathryn M.
comments: I was looking for a cloud/PC app that would allow me to ditch GooglePlay's music app on my PC and android phone (Samsung Note3 is what I presently have).  GooglePlay will allow you to upload your entire library from your PC, either iTunes, Windows Media player, etc.  Its pretty good, all the songs uploaded and you can create playlists and download those playlists to whatever device you're using.Amazon's does that, pretty much.  However, not all songs uploaded.  I tried rescanning and rescanning, and ever time it finds a few more songs to upload.  One album of mine in particular it absolutely refuses to upload.  Nothing is wrong with the format, or any of the locations I tried moving the songs to in order to try an upload... just tells me there isn't anything new in the folders to upload.  And no, they are not in the amazon library at all with me just missing them.  I checked the entire darn thing.Also, it uploaded quite a few songs multiple times.  Some songs won't play all the way through.  I can't seem to find a way to move an entire playlist to my device instead of just streaming the music using my data that I am limited on.  Since I don't have a wifi connection at work, this is pretty much useless for me.I like that I can use amazon prime music and get a lot of songs free, but since I can't get the app to work on my computer anyway (tried many times, and I'm tech savvy enough to be able to do that kind of thing) Amazon music isn't for me just yet.  Amazon, I hope you can fix these items, you're so close! :)

title: Fine if you only get your music from Amazon.
author: Christopher Kelly
comments: This app is solid, but it's working overtime to force my loyalty to Amazon. I get it; they're giving me a free app, that's their call. But the app struggles to find the MP3s that are already on my phone, and the music files I download from Amazon are in a proprietary format that other players can't recognize. Also, I have no control over the location of that music. Overall, it feels like this app is trying to control my experience in a way that other music players don't. If you really only get your music from Amazon Prime, then this is a great option. If you have a large collection of MP3s from multiple sources, then this app is more trouble than it's worth.

title: Sigh, Amazon why do you keep breaking my heart.
author: Mongo
comments: Used to be OK, nothing spectacular, but did what it was supposed to. However it no longer plays my offline music when not connected to the internet. This kind of defeats the purpose. Between this and all of the issues I have with prime shipping not actually delivering to my house since they insist on using surepost, I think its time to wean myself off Amazon. Kind of shame, it was a fantastic company, but they apparently are so busy doing new stuff that nobody is minding the day to day stuff.

title: For Roku App
author: RKB60
comments: This is a review for the Amazon Music App for the Roku. I will preface this by saying I have a Fire TV, And a Fire stick, yet My Roku Stick's app will not let me stream Amazon Prime Music unless I own it. Why is the app features not the same across the board? Amazon has always claimed they didn't make a lot of money on the hardware but it was a way to entice people into joining Amazon Prime. I probably should not be venting on this site but maybe someone will listen. I still like Amazon Prime but there are some chinks in the armor. It will be interesting to see some of the decisions they make in the near future.

title: Disappointing
author: Stephen
comments: Nice interface, can be a pain to navigate.  VERY LIMITED music selections, but don't worry, you can pay more to buy the music you want to listen to, or pay more to upload more of the songs you own.  Disappointed...

title: Galaxy S3
author: C. Zars
comments: With the latest update I've exchanged emails about missing music that the other apps have no problem finding.  In the cloud, the app still can't find some of my son's and had to go through the process of downloading them one at a time all over again.  See where I work they won't allow us access to the cloud so having songs on my S3 is important to have my music on my device.  Amazons update has lost 500 songs that I can't play.When I contacted Amazon they said clearcache. When that didn't work they said to refresh the cloud.  When that didn't work they said uninstall and reinstall.  Now they want me to call them and troubleshoot the app problem with them.Um excuse me but it id your app that has the problem, not me. I don't have time to sit on the phone and troubleshoot your bad app that keeps crashing, wants $24.99 a year to store my music when there are others out there that are free

title: I love Amazon Music
author: mia's mom
comments: I love Amazon Music.  I can stream it in the car or even when I'm travelling abroad.  There are so many different genres of music.  If you're not too keen on a particular song or songs, you can skip it (as many times as you want- unlike pandora non-premium) or  give it a thumbs down and it won't ever play again.

title: me to stream prime songs on roku
author: Joselyn's Amazon
comments: pleased with the app on the phone but very disappointed to find that all of the prime songs that are available are unable to be streamed on the Cloud Player for the Roku box I don't understand why this is possible because all the prime available movies are able to be streamed on the application for the Roku box why can't the prime eligible Songz be available for streaming on the cloud? I'm a very loyal Prime member and I wish that I could play my part I'm sold on the Amazon Cloud Player on my Roku

title: Five Stars
author: Shutter Speed
comments: Great! I downloaded lots of songs that I can use it when I'm travelling abroad!

title: I got the Blues
author: Gene
comments: too many pauses for the streaming to work, Can not listen to a complete song.

title: ... harassment to pay them $10-20 a month for their crappy music staff
author: devildog2006
comments: I am really enjoying this app and Apple recently completely ruined iTunes and I am fed up with my music getting deleted by them and now the inability in the Apple music app to play music from all of an artists album straight through and the constant harassment to pay them $10-20 a month for their crappy music staff. I have also noticed, the sound quality on Amazon music is way better and louder then when I listen in the Apple app. The bottom line: Ditching Apple iTunes like a bad habit, switching everything over to Amazon, and I may even add a cloud subscription so I can upload all of the stuff I have purchased from iTunes over the year to have it in one place. Please, please, keep it good and continue adding more music, and don't feel the need to copy Apple. Apple let its success got to its head and is on the decline, this is a breath of fresh air.

title: What I don't like
author: Carolyn Broomfield
comments: I don't like how it cancel your usage of music

title: Awesome
author: MorLuv5
comments: It's the best I totally love having my music here I love how easily it downloads when I purchase it it is definitely cool sometimes it does freeze but hey that's expected it could possibly be my phone

title: Lack of cross-compatibility between music services has led me to ...
author: Ernest Christiansen
comments: Lack of cross-compatibility between music services has led me to the place where I rarely purchased music anymore. I miss the days of CDs when this was not an issue.

title: It's gotten better....but could get even better
author: David S.
comments: I love having access to music via my Prime account.  This app still needs a little work.  At times it is sluggish.  I can't seem to get it to make a post to my Facebook account to show what I'm listening to (not a huge loss there).  Navigation can be frustrating on a device.  The web interface is a bit better.  Give me an option to see my cloud music and also separate my owned music from my Prime favorites.  That would help me a bit.  Also, how about letting me pick a genre and just start playing songs in random order.  Kinda like a radio.  I'd love to be able to thumb up/down a song in that mix to skip that type of music.** Updated on 11-14-2014The Android app has gotten very good (a new phone also helped).  I logged into the Windows desktop app last night and SURPRISE!!!!  Prime Stations!  How about adding that feature to the Android app?  I think that would be awesome!

title: Coming from spotify subscriber
author: Adrian
comments: I miss spotify simple and easy gestures. From just being able to slide down the album cover from the top instead of having to press an arrow from the left top corner(furthest angle to reach when using dominant hand). Why is it that I have to add a song to the cloud in order to make a separate playlist. That very feature will cause accumulation of different music types. Also the lack of music choice feels significantly limited. Change the layout too it's just so boring and unorganized. Also add dates of albums to know what's new and maybe popularity LEVELS of music. There's potential but there a lot to work on. One thing I do like is the lyrics. But please look at your rivals and actually compete.-iPhone 6s user-

title: Nice app
author: K. Dillingham
comments: Good if you have prime already.  It's a shame you have to pay more to get all the music choices.  If I didn't have prime, I would not pay for it.  Too many cheaper options out there, but it's a great perk with Prime.  It does need search improvement.  Sometimes I know certain genres exist but it doesn't know how to found the right style.

title: Like it 4 stars worth
author: K Young
comments: I like Amazon music with prime much better than Pandora... it's FREE (with Prime).  Now... if it were as easy to use as Pandora and others, it would 5 star.  I love that it doesn't limit the skip forwards... you can still rate the songs... and there are SO many choices.  Just ANOTHER reason to get prime, every year.

title: I never thought that I'd find something better. But with Amazon Prime there's so much free ...
author: D. Hildebrandt
comments: I was a loyal Pandora subscriber for 4 years. I never thought that I'd find something better. But with Amazon Prime there's so much free music that in a couple of months, I've got 1000+ songs. Sometimes I listen to music by album, sometimes by artist and sometimes I just play the songs in alphabetical order. I haven't had time to watch the free movies yet but I've checked through the titles and there's plenty that I'd like to watch. I'm also looking forward to watching Transparent, the original series with Jeffrey Tambor.

title: I cant believe I can get such great quality music free this has been an eye opening ...
author: Jodi
comments: I cant believe I can get such great quality music free this has been an eye opening experience.The music is ordered by artist, genre etc. wish made me realize i really like alternative rock but had no idea that was even a genre of music. I wish it had a wider selection  especially of songs that have been extremely popular (it doesn't have Bastille Pompeii). On the bright side I've been able to listen to a wider selection of artists, I love listening to all these Broadway soundtracks too. Just a great overall app.

title: Frustrating because promising
author: Amazon Customer
comments: This app frustrates me far more than any other on my phone (an Atrix).  I uploaded all of my music onto the cloud player in the hope that it would finally unify all of my fragmented music collections; it has done so fairly well on my various computers (though the tagging and "Unknown Artist" issues still pose problems), and I love the browser interface.  However, the android app needs a lot of work on the core functionality.  If it worked as it's supposed to it would be spectacular, offering the capability to buy a song from the store, then switch to the cloud player and play it instantly.  It would also free up all the sd card space that music eats up (at least while you can stream it over wifi).  In practice, though, it just doesn't offer the experience it promises.  It force closes about 60% of the time I try to use it.  When I try to scroll through the list of artists on the cloud player it stutters horribly (and usually then force closes).  Music playback often skips.  This last issue may be android's fault, as I've noticed it in other players, though never so badly as in the amazon one.  However, I don't experience the other problems in different music players.  Until Amazon fixes these issues, this app is still just another dumb music locker that allows you to download songs so you can play them with some other application.  It's an exciting idea, and the interface would be excellent if it just worked.

title: New to Amazon music
author: linda
comments: I just started using Amazon Music and am really enjoying it. I cannot wait to hear all of the music that I have missed over the years. Today I listened to Classic Country and it brought wonderful memories of my mom and my childhood. Truely the best so far.

title: Love using Amazon music everywhere I go
author: Joseph Egan
comments: Love using Amazon music everywhere I go.  I have Amazon prime for music, movies and shows and am extremely happy with the selection.  I know other choices has more at this point but for the price of prime it is worth it.

title: Best Option for Cross Country Music
author: Keith
comments: Had Pandora before but then realized that Amazon Music was included in my Prime membership at no additional charge.  Tried out Amazon Music for a week and immediately cancelled my Pandora subscription as I decided I had been wasting my money.  Since then I can honestly say that I am completely satisfied with Amazon Music.  I recently drove from California to Texas and back, streaming Amazon Music the whole way.  This was SO much better than either searching for a local station or paying for satellite radio.  Mark me as Very Satisfied.

title: Incredible
author: Frank Williamson
comments: Its incredible.  So current.  Great recommendations based on picks.  Hardly ever quits.  Good sound

title: I love the Amazon music app that I get because of ...
author: A. Aguilar
comments: I love the Amazon music app that I get because of my Prime membership. I get to listen ALL of my favorite music. I have found almost every song I have ever loved and added it. You can listen by playlists that you make yourself or pre-made playlists. You can listen by album or artist too. I really love having this. There's always new music that I can listen to and the best part about it is, there isn't any COMMERCIALS or pop up ADVERTISEMENTS! Prime Music is the Best. I can skip a song, I can repeat the song just played, read the lyrics, and either use the thumbs up and they respond with "we will play more like that," or thumbs down. "we won't play that song again.!" How perfect is that? I LOVE this app! I received this item at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.

title: SAD.  SAD.  SAD.
author: Jabee
comments: After reading ALL the reviews it looks like Amazon is becoming just like  AT&T , GREEDY; continually  increasing  prices.  I have no intention to download this App.

title: Keep Working on It Amazon...Please!
author: Jason Dunn
comments: I really like Amazon's cloud music drive. I've uploaded all of my music to it - currently just under 16K songs - and I buy all my music from Amazon. So I should really love this app, right? No. First off, with the amount of music I have, I think in terms of genres. I don't think "I want to hear artist XYZ today", I think "I'm in the mood for..." and pick a genre, then pick an album or artist from that genre. The fact that Amazon doesn't allow me to select music by genre on this app is absolutely baffling. Please Amazon, add this feature. It's PAINFUL not to have it.Secondly, as someone who changes phones often (typically using overseas models) and lives in the USA, it's hugely frustrating that Amazon is so fiercely geographically fixated on only allowing the "right" version of this app on your phone, then logging you into Amazon.co.uk where none of your music exists. Yes, I'm an edge case, but come on Amazon - why do you have to cause me so much frustration? Just let me log into my account and let me play my music.

title: Not compatible with Kindle HDX 8.5
author: Michelle E.A. Woolard
comments: Why would you make an app that's not compatible with your own devices? I'd say that's a big, fat fail, Amazon!

title: Where's the free streaming with Prime?
author: Tigersfan1065
comments: It sucks! How do I stream the "millions of songs for free" with my Prime membership? Poor application. Way to fool us into your massive benefits of Prime, Amazon.Everything wants me to pay another boatload of money for Music Unlimited. No thanks, not ever. Fool me once...

title: The android app is lacking, no tone or equalization.
author: Phil A.
comments: This sounds like a great idea in theory. I have prime, I like music!  The thing is, the android app isn't that great.  There is no tone or equalization of any kind.  Too bad... I could really get on-board with the concept.  I'll keep buying my music, I guess.

title: and really like the music
author: Bearair
comments: I've used this app for over a year, and really like the music.  HOWEVER, the last couple months I've been getting warnings about data usage from Verizon.  Every time I look for what's using data, I find that this app player is open and running.  I keep turning it off and it keeps turning the player back on in the background.  After removing the app, reinstalling it and removing it again, I've discovered that it was the reason my battery life is lousy.  Something in this app has started to run in the background, chew through battery and result in data charges.I used to really like this app and listened regularly for quite some time.  It's only the last 2 months that something in this app has been causing an issue.  In back to back testing with the app installed, then uninstalled (not using it at all), I went from having roughly 30% battery left at 5PM versus 70% battery left at 5PM.  Reinstalled the app, was back to 50% battery by noon yesterday, then removed the app.  Today I have 86% battery left at 1:30 PM.  The power figures I quoted are WITHOUT EVEN RUNNING THE APP.  If I used it, I had to recharge my phone before 4PM.  The phone was also always warm with the app installed, which is a sure sign of power usage.I'd say that's pretty definitive.  There is something running in the background that cannot be turned off.  It was eating my battery and eating my data.  It didn't do it until the last couple months, so they've changed something in the app. that's causing the issue.  I removed it from my phone and the phone is back to normal.  I will miss it as I used to use it regularly.  But, I don't like being spied on.

title: disaster product
author: peachfront
comments: App won't ever install on my Samsung Galaxy 8, thus, I can't listen to mp3s I previously purchased from Amazon.

title: Be warned that price equals bitrate
author: K. Z. Mahon
comments: ===Update #2: Amazon has refunded my order fully :)Please understand that I am dissatisfied with the bitrates of the mo3s, and not the overall quality of the service.===Update: 4/29, and Amazon refunded me for the first album,  but none of the others, only because I forgot to note them in the initial contact;  I presumed Amazon would do so, seeing as I mentioned the number previously and my failing to mention them was my error.  I have emailed to request a complete refund, and will up the rating once this occurs.Note: I attempted to verify the bitrates on the album pages, but I was directed to AmazonMP3's app, which didn't offer any product details.I realize that I am being very OCD here,  but as a huge fan of both Amazon and the Archeophone Archives products,  as a consumer, I want the best quality possible.
