Give me that at a good price, and I'm very happy to spend all my fun money here :)===I bought 4 mp3 albums for the first time over the past few days, featuring acoustic-era phonograph music.  Given my past experience with Amazon,  I was greatly dissatisfied upon listening to the albums because they're 256kbps and I was expecting,  if not lossless FLAC, then at least full-320kbps.It may not be much of a difference,  but as a fan of this music, I am VERY disappointed on principle alone and would love a refund of these four $8.99 albums. I thought I was paying for full quality and I am not receiving it.This is my first low-star review for Amazon. com

title: Great app
author: Beardedone1984
comments: Cool app despite what others say. Once you play a song fully you done need to download it at all. It will play in your offline music as if it was on your phone. Very useful

title: Four Stars
author: Howard
comments: Good app. Just stop trying to up sell people. Just have all the music included.

title: Why, if it's "free" do I have to put ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Why, if it's "free" do I have to put my credit card info in to download this app???  I have been burned once by unauthorized use of my Amazon music account and could not speak to a person who could understand English well enough to fix it so I ended up cancelling my whole account.  I do not want to put my credit card info in to listen to the "free" Ripped version of my album that came with the CD I just purchased.  I want another way to listen so HELP!

title: 50/50 Player
author: The Nerdy Hillbilly
comments: 1. Very Good Quality And Design For Android2. Downloaded Prime Music Is Cleared Every Once In Awhile3. Slow To Load4. Protected M4a Can't Be Read On Other Players5. Constantly SYNCS

title: the music is nice to listen to
author: Dan Ramirez
comments: the music is nice to listen to, at times. Then again eating up my high speed data can be somewhat annoying, if not loathsome. To me I see this app as the corporate version of napster. They would love to share their music with you and give it to you in an unlimited amount of empty files and constant commercials selling you something every other second from every direction in the form of music track and albums for sale. As well as other apps and other membership services. Basically it's a rent to own type deal letting you download certain tracks to your device without giving you full access to files and always giving the option to buy.  .... rent it as long as you like you never own anything unless you purchase it. You can't download to other devices aside form the device the app is installed in. The files being only accessible via the app so when your no longer a member there's no longer music it would seem. hmmm... something to think about.

title: Good For My Needs - Recommended
author: C. Hill
comments: This "Amazon MP3" app provides a clean and easy interface to access the music files on my HTC EVO 4G or from the Amazon "Cloud". I use this app every night to play my "Brown Noise" for sleeping and generally whenever I want to listen music through my phone.Using the app is straight forward, with a simple layout and standard player controls. You can select to display the music in the Cloud, previously downloaded to the device, or access the Amazon "Store". The app also allows downloading your Cloud stored MP3 files to your device but, as other reviewers have noted, it does not allow you to select where they are stored (i.e. to your SD card). The download location shortcoming is not a significant issue for me since I don't have a lot of music files, but this would be an issue for someone like my daughter who has hundreds of files.The ease of use and access to the Cloud stored files makes this a good choice for my needs.Recommended!CFH

title: Good Cloud Player but....
author: Robert S.
comments: This is a great way to play your music from the cloud. But if you want to take say 10GB of your favorite music and download it to your SD card so you can listen to it on the train without a data stream....well, you can't.Let's say your device has 5GB of onboard storage and you have a 64GB SD card. Where do you think this app would create its default download directory?  The local device of course. Well, just change the default download directory to the SD card and....oh wait a second, you can't. They don't permit this. So you buy their music and you can't store it on your SD card. Why do people buy SD cards in the first place? So they can store large files like photos, videos, and yes - MUSIC.  Good job Amazon, good job!

title: This update sucks
author: LolaRay
comments: I actually relatively liked this app until the most recent update. I deleted some songs off my phone and wanted to re-download them, only to find out that the option isn't available because on the app it lists it as already being downloaded. Not only that but the partner program on the computer has to have the most needlessly complicated way of uploading music to your Amazon music library, and that's if it even works. Literally worked fine the day prior, and now the program is barely running, and when it finally does run when I try and drag the songs I wanted to upload into my library, it says no songs were added.

title: Trying to download your purchased music? good luck
author: Je
comments: They try to keep your music captive in Prime.If you've purchased music and downloaded it to your offline library, you may not see it in your other apps that you actually play music it.If you have a problem with the app, they'll tell you to delete everything and you'll have to re-download all your music, that can be hundreds to thousands of songs.Support is outsourced. They told me to logon to amazon and delete the music from there and try to re-download.That will actually permanently delete your music and you'll lose it forever.The app has no EQ so you'll have a less enjoyable music experience unless you play through another app.

title: It sure would be nice to browse my library on the FireTV once again
author: Craig Clayton
comments: I've been using Prime Music and even pay for the annual subscription to have Amazon host all the music I own. Since the latest update to the FireTV I can't access Amazon music. I just gives me a message that I need to update it, but I have yet to find a way to do that. It sure would be nice to browse my library on the FireTV once again. I love the new FireTV OS interface but if this keeps up I might as well go back to my Roku.

title: Unavailable for Kindle Fire???
author: H. Herrmann
comments: Is this an Amazon product? WTH!? I use this app on my android phone and have playlists set up and everything. But heaven forbid I actually try to use this on an actual Amazon tablet. Ridiculous! I am seriously disappointed.

title: Waste until they let one use external storage
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Good idea. But takes all your memory if you download to listen without streaming. Amazon let us use SD storage for the music, otherwise it's a waste to have this app.

title: Great variety of music
author: Chris
comments: Great variety of music, but Amazon should not charge extra for some songs, I already pay PRIME, what is the point.????

title: Needs serious improvement
author: D. Calcagno
comments: While I enjoy the radio stations on my iPhone, its not exactly the best app as far as navigation goes.  It is far too complicated to go backwards and "like" a song and often ends up in repeating a song over or restarting the song I was listening to.  Pandora is much simpler to use.  I also am disappointed in my "cloud" albums.  I've bought MANY a CD from Amazon before streaming became the "thing" and VERY few albums are actually available to listen to.  I originally thought the idea that my music that I've purchased over the years being available to be all the time without having to load up space on my phone or always carry my iPod around was a great idea, now with such limited choices, I'm no longer impressed.  My other REAL ISSUE with this app is its own incompatibility with Amazon Fire Stick.  Why in the world would amazon make an App that isn't compatible with one of its own devices?

title: Living outside the U.S., I can't use it.  :(
author: DanO
comments: Well, this app is probably great if I lived in America.  Since I live South Korea I cannot download this app because it's blocked.  If it ever becomes available for download here I will update my review.  Until then...

title: Better than nothing
author: Alejandro Barreda
comments: Better than nothing, no variety, the streaming many times doesn't work, need improvement on selection, just copy the software from Pandora and this will be great.

title: Cool Service...Great Addition For Prime Members...Horrible Usability (It's not user friendly)
author: JOSH HOELKER
comments: Prime Music is good, it's cool, it's great....but you think a company like Amazon.com would have thought to invested more of its BILLIONS OF DOLLARS into actually testing usability of the product (both desktop & mobile). It's obvious they didn't spend enough time on the service, and its a poor reflection on it's customer-centric brand promise (Or Jeff Bezos needs to rethink who's running Prime Music). I gave three starts only because the music is free, great sound quality, and its a convenient addition to my prime membership.That being said, I am not impressed with the service. It's too difficult to find the music you want and its ridiculous that you have to add prime songs to your library to listen to the full song. I'll give them some credit because the service is fairly new, but COME ON MAN! YOU ARE AMAZON.COM! If you're going to compete with Spotify, Pandora, and soon to be YouTube then compete. I'm giving it a chance, but wont be surprised is I revert back to using the unpaid Spotify service. As a prime member, I demand more & I expect more specially when it comes to music.

title: AMAZON MUSIC
author: Debi
comments: Love the variety of music and the lyrics part of it, then I can sing along...

title: Good to worse
author: BookReviewer
comments: I recently updated app (nov.2016) and app is terrible. Cuts off and on constantly  while listening to a  track.  Very disappointing.  It was a great app, now terrible.

title: Good product
author: SeeKeen
comments: Definitely worthwhile - I use it in the car while traveling.

title: Here we go AGAIN
author: Gemzzz
comments: Another bloated, oversized app with 32 permissions, ridiculous lack of features, wants to sit on the memory of the internal SD, and is unfriendly to older smartphones.  Just another Prime "benefit" that is totally unusable because, once again, Amazon hired The Three Stooges to develop the app that runs it.  Nyuck THAT.Amazon - If you want families to begin flocking to your Prime club, make the benefits available to ALL ITS MEMBERS and for ALL DEVICES, or they feel cheated for the price they're paying you for Prime, especially after the INCREASE. Got an email today saying this music service is now available for Prime members, so get ready for the big disappointment when the Prime members realize it's just another component that is seriously lacking and not adding to the reasons why one should subscribe.

title: Can't say much because I didn't even know about the ...
author: Always April
comments: Can't say much because I didn't even know about the music until now and Iv been paying for Google music every month.

title: Love this app.
author: cathy graeve
comments: I really like Amazon Music.it keeps track of my library, easy to find songs and albums, has a lot of great songs and albums for free. I am very pleased with this app. Would recommend it to my family and Friends.

title: Great App!
author: Kenneth F.
comments: Considering the music is "free" with a prime account, I find it an incredible value.  Entire albums download very quickly and can be saved or offline use as not to drain your data.I give it four stars, for now, because I have only been using it a few days, and am having some trouble navigating and performing different task.  I do not see any "help" icons.

title: This is absolutely the worst app EVER
author: Amazon Customer
comments: This is absolutely the worst app EVER. Unfortunately I other prime featurez all the time so I  not going to subscribe to a different service.Music will skip when playing from cloud or offline libraries after playing 10-12 songs. I had been fixing it by killing the prime music app and restarting it (hmm just like windows). Support or lack there of has been trying to fix it for more than two months now. Last solution was to upgrade to version 4.6.2. Swing and miss. Now the player controls no longer display on my lock screen. Yet another undocumented feature.If you are. Not already a prime member or looking to become a prime member for the streaming music? DO NOT DO IT!!!I had to give the app one star in order to post the review and its not worth that. Should have a negative 5 star option

title: I want to love it, but no learning radio function like pandora? No thanks.
author: Kevink
comments: It has great sound quality, but it is very difficult to use. You have to know exactly what you want to listen to. I don't understand why they don't incorporate an intuitive radio player that you can enter several artists into and then rate played songs to have it learn what to play, basically just like pandora. If they could do this I'd be all in. I will still use prime bc there are MANY other benefits and utilization's for it.If an amazon customer service person see's this, let me know if there is something like this available, bc I REALLY want to use it, the controls and interface (in browser) are just very non-intuitive, much like the rest of amazon's website.

title: Just finished talking with Verizon why all of a sudden ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Just finished talking with Verizon why all of a sudden I had data overages.  We analyzed my phone and their network to see what the problem was.  It was Amazon Music.  I downloaded the app about a month ago and looked at it once.  The app ran up 3.6GB of data usage in the background (for what I haven't a clue) without me ever hearing a note.  This app appears to be dangerous.  I uninstalled because you can't trust that it's not pulling data from Amazon servers.  have no issues with Google Play. Luckily Verizon understood since I only use about .5GB a month and this app pulled 3.6GB for no apparent reason.

title: Decent app, subpar widget and notifications
author: M. Thomas
comments: As a prime subscriber, I was pleased to have this additional service added. I don't enjoy making playlists, and I always opt to use premade or instant playlists. Amazon offers playlists that cater to my tastes, and which include some songs I like that I don't otherwise have in my library. In that respect, I really like what Amazon has brought to the table. That said, I do have a few issues with the app. Streaming on my PC is perfectly fine, but the streaming playback on my Android phone is always choppy at the beginning of each song. My LTE coverage is perfectly good, and Google Play has never had trouble streaming on my phone. My second issue with the app is that it wipes out the active playlist after a few hours of being paused. I want to get out of work and just push play and pick up where I left off. I don't want to have to find that playlist again and figure out where I was. The last issue I have is that the notification tray play button doesn't work for me. This might have to do with the fact that my playback is always paused via unplugging an auxiliary audio cable, but the play button should work regardless. I don't have too much to say about the fullscreen app itself, as I only use it to pick my playlist.

title: Redesign needed deserpately
author: rkclayton
comments: I want to love this service so bad.  It has a good selection of music and its included with prime so whats not to love?  I'll tell you...The entire set up is garbage.  I don't know who they hired to design it but it is the most complicated way to listen to music that I have found to date.  Before you can listen to songs you must "add" them to your library which then forces you to go to another screen to listen to them.  What if you just want to listen once?The mobile app doesn't allow you to search by Artist.  SERIOUSLY?They need to drop the shopping cart idea and take a good look at Google music.  I don't want to jump through hoops to listen to music, It should just work with little effort.  This is coming from someone who works in IT; sure I can figure all this out but I shouldn't have to.  Google music all the way

title: Better than not having music
author: justinjpogue
comments: It plays the music, and has a lot free on it in addition to what I've got privately and what I've purchased through Amazon, so all of that is great.  Additionally, it's free with Prime, so unlike competitor's apps (Spotify), I'm not paying $9.99 a month for this.  That having been said...I use Spotify 90% of the time, and Amazon Prime Music the other 10%, largely only for music Spotify doesn't have.  It's all in the UX/UI:  The interface here leaves most things to be desired, and that's the whole ball game.

title: It is a good app for Amazon's first time doing a app with ...
author: James V
comments: It is a good app for Amazon's first time doing a app with prime music. Yes it has it's problems. Music cuts out from time to time. On my nexus5 phone and the app does not work on some devices like my monster cable M7 tablet just loads and loads but does not play music. "Note all my products are brand new so it is the app."Also this app is not setup for roku at this time. Amazon has lots of work ahead of them but the idea is there for a great prime music app just need to get it to work in more ways then one. Hope to see more from amazon soon.

title: Slow. Unresponsive. Disappointing.
author: Larry E Moore Jr
comments: Super slow. I've contacted Amazon several times, but it just sits and loads. Wait up to a minute or more just to get it to show my artists, then after opening the album another 30 seconds or more to recognize what song I tap. After that it can take another minute to actually play. I'm switching to Google play.Tried the uninstall reinstall route several times. All it yielded me was having to redownload my music and ended with the same result.

title: App has great features and is easy to navigate.
author: Nashy
comments: This app is very easy to navigate and shop. Easily add individual songs or entire albums to customizable playlists. Stream music or download to your device, filter options are great too. Set up options include automatic downloading of purchases and download locations (i.e internal or SD card) There is an optional widget for my home screen which shows album covers and I really like the one touch to play capability. Very pleased with this app.

title: I have one issue, but it's a BIG issue ...
author: Kevin
comments: I have one issue, but it's a BIG issue.  Amazon Music does not maintain playlists across devices/PC.  Songs that I add to a playlist on one device or my PC are added to one giant list of 'recently added' in the cloud.  When I move to a different instance of the app, I have to move the songs to the playlist again.  This alone kills it for me.

title: App Crashes Tablet...
author: JP
comments: Used this app for about a month now but have not had it successfully work during that time. The app will launch momentarily and then force close. Following this my tablet will be sluggish until I reboot it. Through process of trial and error I stopped all apps and narrowed it down to when this particular app runs, it causes an issue. I've attempted fresh installs and clearing the cache but none of this has been successful. Even reading somewhere that the app was not compatible with equalizers, which I would hope has at least been accommodated by this point; disabling the equalizer features has been unsuccessful. After these problems and no fix, I just uninstalled it.

title: ... learning how to use it but so far so good.
author: George Mansfield
comments: I'm still learning how to use it but so far so good. Thanks

title: Take it with ya!!  :)
author: Rich B.
comments: Great way to take your music with you. I have had ZERO issues with the app. Only time I have what I might consider an issue is if my cell connection is weak, other than that, works like a charm. Great selection of genres and artists.

title: Too Simple!
author: Barbara Thomas
comments: Took only a minute to click, and download to our PC. Gives us instant access to our playlists and a world of music.

title: Missing many big name artists
author: Donald K. Kuchta
comments: A lot of music artists not available and the cover and karaoke versions generally suck. I use it because it comes with my prime subscription. I would never use it as my only option to buy my music.

title: Alexa Products.
author: Richard R. Parks
comments: I have this on my IPhone but it wont let me load to my Samsung android. Cn an one help?

title: Amazon needs to fix this
author: medusa_woman
comments: It seems that the better this app gets, the more it crashes or doesn't play music.  I sit in the same spot every day -- at work -- with the same device -- 6 months ago, it played fine -- (I'm talking about music in the cloud only -- music that I downloaded works fine).  Now it locks up or it just doesn't play music at all -- it attempts to play, but then skips to the next song.  Real frustrating.  I'm satisfied with the music selection -- I don't expect to have everything, so that's ok.  Love the playlists and the flexibility of arranging them on my PC.  But Amazon really needs to work on this cloud issue.  For the record, each morning, I restart my phone and clear my cache -- my phone is about 85% filled -- so I believe the issue is the Amazon.  They need to get on this or lots of us are going to go to Spotify, Pandora etc.  In addition, I'm also have playback problems watching shows on my TV -- again, I didn't have this problem 6 months ago.  If it doesn't clear up soon, I may not renew next year.

title: How do I hate thee? Let me count the ways....
author: Chris
comments: First, let me say: I have an Amazon Kindle Fire -- and I love it. This app is NOT the app that runs on the Kindle Fire. This app is, instead, what you run on an Android phone/tablet. With that being said:This app is crap. It's entire focus is to get you to BUY music, rather than stream music from your Amazon Cloud Drive. The app is incredibly commercial-centric. From the moment you start it up you're given two choices/buttons: Cloud Drive Music or Store. Each time you boot it up, you get the same two stupid buttons: Cloud Drive or Store. The "Store" is ever present, regardless of where  you may be within the app. What's more, the app continuously crashes hangs on my multiple devices: LG Optimus Slider, Motorola Triumph, and XOOM tablet. Regardless of whether you are using Froyo, Gingerbread, Ice Cream Sandwich, etc. EXPECT crashes and hangs. This app is total, total worthless crap if you have a lot of music on your Cloud Drive (like I do).Amazon could do sooo much better.... Again: Total crap.

title: We really love Amazon music
author: Woods Family
comments: We really love Amazon music. The ONLY reason I am giving it a 4 is that we have a large family of 8 and we cannot all use the service because it is limited to only a few devices. Please, please, please increase the number of devices in general or consider making exceptions for larger families, even if proof is needed that the  members are living in same household or something like that. It would be fair if it allowed for a maximum number being the members of a family (ours is 8). Many thanks for an otherwise FANTASTIC service!!!

title: Google Play has more recent version of this app?
author: Mr. Freeze
comments: Sad that the most recent version of this app is available only from Google Play. Why Amazon releases to Google Play FIRST - before making it available on their  own Appstore - is inane - and inconvenient - as packages are signed with different keys.

title: Selfish capitalist motives > terrible version 5.0
author: lindros
comments: This is an absolute disaster. I can't use the app, can't listen to my music (I pay $25/year for the library/matching), and all in the name of some selfish person at Amazon who decided to launch Unlimited and clog up what used to be a great app.Wasn't QA'ed. App crashes. Consumes 26% of CPU and 190MB of RAM on a PC.Mac app equally crashes.Android version won't install.

title: Difficulty using it.
author: Barbara H.
comments: Actually, I am having trouble making good use of it so that is why I don't like it.

title: Love the service. Here's a suggestion for liking stuff and providing more feedback on the jams in playlists!
author: M. Ruby
comments: Hey Amazon - GREAT JOB with Amazon Prime Music. I'm loving the curated playlists and the music that is on them. In general there is a great selection of music in Prime.One piece of feedback... I can't do much more to interact with the playlists than rate a playlist overall. I listen to the playlists when I'm at work and have been finding that there are times where I'm liking the music so much I want to "like" or give some sort of feedback live. I've been using Periscope a lot lately and have been the digging the ability to tap little hearts during the live broadcasts. That would be pretty cool to do when I'm listening to Amazon Prime music and you could get more feedback on how people are liking the jams.Keep up the good stuff! This product is moving the right direction and keeps getting better and better.

title: Could be better.
author: J. W
comments: I like it but it could be easier to use complicated for a new user. So get to work Amazon.

title: Best diversity I have heard in years with NO commercials....
author: S. Williams
comments: I love music and diversified genres,,,,this works fantastic....Stations have a fantastic playlist and my clients love the spa music....This is definitely a keeper for listening to music.

title: Great app for music!
author: KP
comments: This is an awesome app. There are too many pros to list but I will name a few. I can listen to any of my music I downloaded from Amazon without downloading the tracks to my phone. All my music is right where I can easily access it. The only con I hace found is that deleting songs from the library is a little harder. You have to delete each individual one and there is no way to select large batches to delete that I have found. Not much of a con so this app still gets 5 stars from me.

title: Not a fan
author: Yasosume
comments: I like the idea, but I feel like this app drains my battery faster than any other music app on my phone. One good thing about it is that you could download the songs into your device after purchasing them so you don't have to use the player it has.

title: Continues to use Mobile data
author: Mikey
comments: WARNING UPDATE - THIS APP CONTINUES TO USE SIGNIFICANT AMOUNTS OF MOBILE DATA EVEN WHEN CONFIGURED TO USE WIFI ONLY. It amounts to 1-3 mb per day. This appears to happen even when it is not being used. Uninstalled!This would be a 5 star for me, but I can't see how to remove downloaded albums from the device. Downloaded playlists can be removed, but not albums. I had to remove each individual song one at a time, this took several minutes due to the slow toast notifications

title: not a fan
author: Kendell ThatsMe
comments: I canceled my subscription for prime music section not a fan of and you still have to buy it.

title: I love it!
author: Alice Marshall Swing
comments: I love it!! I can access virtually anything I want, also it's a great way to fall asleep listening on my Echo!!

title: Horrible. I cannot believe how bad this is
author: Carri
comments: Horrible. I cannot believe how bad this is. Have the app developers or Amazon actually checked out how Pandora/Amazon/Spotify/Slacker work? I'm guessing not. Incredibly frustrating. I am very knowledgeable about Android phones and apps. Very. I support them at my job.All I want to do it play some music. Period. Pick a genre. It takes you to that Genra and a little popup comes up: SAMPLE PLAYLIST? No. I just want to listen to it.Add to my playlist. Go to Playlists. It's not there.Maddening. It took me far too long to figure out how to play a song... but then it's got to be specific songs. I JUST WANT TO HEAR MUSIC IN ONE GENRE. Surprise me. Find em some new music.Oh...look at that. The "playlist" I am listening to just stopped after one song that I added. Really?Already a Prime Member, so I am VERY glad I didn't get Prime just for this. 'Do not let this be a deciding factor over whether or not you go buy Prime.

title: This is one of the free good deals. I know there is a membership involved
author: Pixelfreak
comments: living in a world where nothing is free, This is one of the free good deals. I know there is a membership involved, but consider how much music cost and everthing prime offers, free shipping on most items, free books and current editions.free apps.Cloud storage. acoss all my devices. This music is not old one hit wonders nor music nobody would buy, All the current top artist and no.1 hits, Complete albums and Grammy award artist from every genre, Rap to country and classicical,  It's about time we got something free for out hard earned money.

title: Less Than Happy
author: Rich S
comments: I am not too well familiar with online music sites, but I found Amazon Music to be more than confusing.  There really aren't any "instructions" to walk me through the process of selecting music and sharing it with other devices.  I still haven't figured out how to link Amazon Music with my home Wi-Fi network and/or surround sound system.  In addition, when I access Amazon Music using my Samsung Tablet, the site keeps crashing.

title: Where's the support?
author: Mary Bonner
comments: I attempted to use Amazon Music with my Prime Membership and spent a couple of hours trying to get some helpful support from customer service.  I downloaded the App to my IPAD  from my App Store and when I tried to access some music, I received a message that I needed to sign up for Amazon Music.  I then downloaded what seemed to be the same App from Amazon, which came with a credit.  Then came the support merry-go-round.  My first rep was difficult for me to understand, very slow to understand me and didn't seem knowledgeable which was understandable since he was in Africa.  After getting an American rep, I was no more successful.  I have received two, not one email welcoming me to Amazon Music, so I guess I had registered but still no clarity on the error message. i QUIT.  Too bad Amazon didn't provide the ease of use that they have with Prime video.

title: Amazing app, unless used with a Roku, so sad.
author: Evelyn S
comments: This is a fabulous app when you have a prime membership.  Unfortunately, full functionality is not available on my Roku device.  Unlike my Smartphone and iPad, you can't access all of the other wonderful music options, all you can access is your own library.  For me, this is a shame because my phone and iPad are not hooked up to my home stereo, while the Roku device is. PLEASE, PLEASE,  Amazon make your apps have the same functionality no matter what device they are being used with.  I hope that you will work with Roku to fix this. That is the reason I couldn't give this app 5 stars.

title: Not good, but usable
author: NevermoreFU
comments: Needs:-Set download location to SD card-Landscape Mode-Show cloud and downloaded music in the same list (Google Music does this well)-When clicking on an Artist, don't just show all the songs, have options for "All Songs" and "Albums" (like Google Music and the iPhone)  when I have a band that has 15 albums, a giant list of songs is not very easy to sort through.  Obviously this is designed for people who buy singles (shame on you).Prime music is pretty awesome, but I'm running out of space quick and the app is a hassle to use.  Worth it for "free" music though.

title: Cloud Music
author: Michael Kerner
comments: There is no question that Amazon.com has definitely been a great superstore for online shopping, but it also has been a great shopping source for purchasing online music as well. But nevertheless, they have also started the trend of keeping your music safe with storage and with your shopping from buying music on CD's and digital music, you can store all of it on their website online music cloud. It handles fairly well, at keeping your music safe so if you can download it over again, and have your autorip music stored here, so if your buying for your friends or keeping your online music safe, this handles well as a must app for your Android devices and Kindle Fire as well. Sadly though, it doesn't have enough recognition with tablets Micro SD cards to play back the music stored there. Also, it could have better playback for when you are playing your cloud-stored music through Wi-Fi. But it still is a great add-on for your Android tablets, but more could've been highlighted.Price: BConvience & Setup: B-Overall: B-

title: End the feud
author: Geoff
comments: App works fine, but Amazon needs to end its feud with Google and get this app in the Play store. Unnecessarily difficult to install this app on a non-Amazon device. Shame on you, Amazon.

title: Great for ios (from Apple Apps) as well (though with some limitations)
author: Zenon P
comments: It says it is for an Android but I got it from iTunes and it works great on an iPhone7 -- except it will not get "Music Unlimited" or at least I don't know how to get those (e.g. Olivia Chaney).

title: I would like to see better searching within prime music
author: Cameron Braidwood
comments: I'm really enjoying your prime service. However, I would like to see better searching within prime music, and that facility to be available on the prime tv box, as I would like to explore your free music in a less random way. In particular, I would like to be able to search for music by duration, as I like to find DJ mix's often included on dance compilations. This is easy to do on soundcloud, but not on prime music. And , as mentioned before, I would really like to search for music via my fire tv box, and listen to it on my TV / sound system in my living room. At the moment, you only have access to albums you have in your collection, or playlists you have added to your prime music account ... you cant generally search.

title: Not what it was
author: Charles H. Griswold
comments: With the advent of Amazon Music, almost anything you want to listen to on Prime is gone, and what's left is junk.Just a scam to get you for $10 a month.Boo Amazon.

title: Works
author: Amazon Customer
comments: It's a nice app, but it has a few bugs. I accidentally downloaded a very large play list form the cloud filling up my tablets storage. Seems there should be a "do you really want to do this" window before starting the download.At first this app didn't work with my new Dell Tablet. After several calls to Amazon the problem was solved. I bought the Tablet form Amazon so this problem should of been solved before hand.

title: More Tunes Please
author: Knight
comments: Would give it Five but it needs more listening options, feels odd paying for Prime just to be told to pay for another Prime to hear more...kinda defeats the purpose

title: Seems good, but some major artists missing (like UNKNOWN HINSON)
author: CMbassist
comments: Have not tried downloading or cloud playing, but the streaming music is high quality and has some advantages over Pandora... Namely being able to listen to full albums and playlists of individual artists without forced "variety". Biggest issue so far- NO UNKNOWN HINSON! Seriously... UNKNOWN HINSON is the KING of Country and Western Troubadors (doubt it? Google it!). How can they even have country music on here and not include the King?! I am sure other artists are missing as well, but it is imperative to include Unknown! Squeaking by on Hank III, even though the edited versions of his songs come up first. It is cool that censored and uncensored versions are available... As a parent, I like that. Battery usage seems comparable to Pandora. No ads (yay)! Just started using this today... So far pretty good. But, seriously- ADD UNKNOWN HINSON! Then this would be great!

title: Great features!
author: D. Romero
comments: I like the listen off line feature.

title: gotten worse
author: just a thought
comments: Previous to the "Prime Music" being intertwined with the player/downloader I thought this was a great app.  I used it on my iphone 4s with very few problems.  It ran on my Samsung Galaxy in the same manner.  Now I absolutely abhor this app.  Trying to download an album without the 1000 error code is not possible for me.  Now instead of trusting that the entire album has been downloaded I need to double check.  It is not my network connection nor the network.  I run in to these problems at home, work, even when running 4G as the only wireless connection.  I now have a note 3 and these same problems persist.  Not impressed at all.There are other issues with the app such as when the "red exclamation" (indicating a download error) icon appears on the "Song" line.  Quickly touching this icon should take you to a pop up screen asking if you want to retry or cancel the download.  Half of the time when I hit that button the player opens and tries to play the song.  Very annoying when you are in a meeting and trying to stay awake:)

title: Like the service, Android App rather disappointing
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Like the prime service over all, but rather disappointed in not being able to store music on the SD Card. Really have trouble believing that this use case wasn't brought up in the process of developing the android app as storing music and other media on the SD Card is very common.  I can guess that storing stuff on the SD Card (world readable, 777 all that) is likely at odds with whatever deals they struck to 'protect' the music (I'm guessing files are not DRM'd, but rather they are relying on some File System level protection on the internal storage ... kinda mixed feelings there).  All the same, I hope Amazon gets that this model/method won't last, not at least for Android deployments.Also, I find the new 'prime' interface rather complex for what should be a pretty straightforward app. Oft times, I just want to see What's on my phone and make a playlist from that ... and it can be rather difficult.

title: 0 Stars should be an option
author: Squeaky D
comments: It interrupts at intervals of 10 seconds to a couple minutes to load a song, meaning it sometimes takes 10 minutes to play a 3 minute song. This is on a T3 connection at 2:30 p.m. CST, so no peak times or slow connections can explain this away, so the streaming function is worthless. Add that to the fact it is very hard to even find your music and that the user must be very careful to not be tricked into buying songs even though Amazon advertises it as "Free" music. I never thought I could dislike a music service more than Pandora... but this takes the poo cake.

title: This thing is awful
author: jeff c
comments: I used to use this app a lot. I even spent the 25 bucks to get the expanded Amazon cloud storage and I have uploaded most of my music collection to my Amazon cloud account.  In the old days I could access any song in my collection with a tap on the screen and instantly be enjoying my music.Life was so carefree back then. Then one day THE UPDATE came. Now this app is a wasteland, destroyed by code. It might play a song if I tap on it, but most likely it isn't going to. You can try to play other songs but they probably aren't going to play either. And you know those songs you have saved on your SD card... well they might as well not exist anymore if you're stuck using this app. I hate this app with an unhealthy passion. I think it's mostly because I feel like I've been betrayed by something I once loved.I did find a work around to these problems. I bought an ipod classic. It doesn't hold all my music, but it holds a lot, it doesn't need wi-fi and best of all it plays music when I want to listen to it, not when it feels like it.  Next year I'll save 25 bucks by not renewing my Amazon cloud account. So I've got that going for me, which is nice.

title: It installed fine, would play music but whenever I went to ...
author: Obviousman
comments: I downloaded the Amazon Music Installer app because when I bought a few albums on Amazon I was entitled to download / stream them. Whenever i clicked on the "play or download you music now" link I got an Amazon message telling me there was an error: "Music library error - we encountered an internal error. We are working to resolve this problem as soon as possible. Please close your music library and try again later."After waiting 24 hours for this error to clear I figured the issue might be that I didn't have the Amazon music player installed. It installed fine, would play music but whenever I went to the Amazon store via the music player I still got the same error. I tried using three browsers with the same result.erhaps my issue is not the fault of the music player app but as a "Joe Average" user I don't care about the technical details; I just 'see' that I don't get what I was expecting and thus rate the app poorly.

title: CAN NOT PLAY MUSIC ON MORE THAN 1 DEVICE!!!
author: Josh
comments: CAN ONLY PLAY MUSIC ON 1 DEVICE AT A TIME. Can not play on multiple devices simultaneously. If you have more than one echo, dot, tap, phone etc. you can only listen to music on one device - the others will give an error message if you try and won't play ANY music! We have an echo in several locations in our house, at work, and the app on our iPhones. All devices are unable to play any music if any one other device is using the service. No way to cancel the trial membership either (you can cancel after 30-day-trial ends....). THIS IS A JOKE AMAZON!

title: Not ready for prime time (i.e. really crappy)
author: jfb
comments: This software is total crap as far as I can tell.  I run a Mac Mini with the latest OS on it (10.12.1 as of this review), and all this Amazon Music software shows me is a blank screen.  Not responsive to any commands, I have to force quit.  I deleted all the plist files, preferences, etc, reinstalled, no change.  I've been using PC's and Mac's since they first came out, and I'm pretty handy with them.  This software is not ready for primetime.It's easier to launch a browser window and listen to music through the web app.

title: Freezes constantly, not worth the frustration
author: Amazon Customer
comments: The app on my phone loses its connection and pauses/freezes the music all the time when I'm trying to play my playlists. I don't have this problem with Soundcloud, Spotify, Youtube or other streaming music services so it has nothing to do with the internet connection. It happens almost every time during or after the first song. It's so frustrating and I end up switching to Youtube or another service that I know won't have problems. Not worth paying to have access to unlimited music if Amazon freezes it after one song.....

title: Use for streaming cloud library
author: DJ Farji
comments: Enjoy the app, but only use for streaming my cloud library.  A desired enhancement is ability to play songs on phone acquired from other sources.

title: new app is clunky not likin' it
author: chris smith
comments: uploaded just a few days ago the upgrade is similar to a recent spotify upgrade that i'm also unhappy with re menu and interactivity. but unlike spotify's killer graphics and overall look, the amazon music app is clunky and quite frankly it's ugly. my guess is that unless it changes very soon, i won't be buying as much music on it cuz it's not intuitive for me and i can't find things quickly. the prime feature is also very weak, with not much being offered, just like on prime video which i hardly use. is amazon trying to kill prime? i'm already planning not to renew in the coming year.

title: Memory Hog
author: Dusty14
comments: For those who have accumulated a lot of MP3s in Amazon's cloud and want to access them anywhere, this is essential, but it is frustrating that they didn't put more thought into it.  There is no way to set the storage to be the first place it should look - the SD card! If you want to take some MP3s for use off-line, they quickly fill up the main device storage. You have to keep deleting them and downloading them again, or take the trouble to move them back and forth yourself. If they would take the time to fix this, it would be great.

title: Despite listed specs, does not work with Android 4.1 / tablet sold via Amazon Prime
author: ekacnap
comments: Despite the listed specs, this app will not currently load on at least one Android 4.1 tablet sold via Amazon Prime:  http://www.amazon.com/Double-Power-GS-918-Certified-Android/dp/B00DOJIZF6/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1404259734&sr=8-2&keywords=double+power+tabletVERY disappointing as I bought the tablet based on the stated specs of this particular app (Android 4.0 and higher) - but hopeful Amazon programmers will soon create a work-around.Attempts to load the app currently result in the app defaulting to version 2.8.2 of Amazon MP3 player (no Prime music).

title: Works fine on my Ipad but not on my Android!
author: Luis
comments: My Android works with my Gmail Account, my IPad with my MSN Account. Whe I downloaded the App to my Android and Register it with my MSN Account which is the one on Amazon too, it does not show my Amazon Prime Status. Amazon can do a lot better than what they have!

title: No SD Support?  Really?
author: Dan D
comments: The old Amazon MP3 app automatically stored downloaded music to my SD card, but this new app doesn't even give me the option to do so, which is pretty ridiculous, given that I have a Verizon Elipsis 7 tablet with a 32GB SD card and less than 2GB of internal storage.  Is there any way to revert back to the old app, or is Amazon going to address this issue?  Having read the other reviews here, I can see that I'm not alone.  Please Amazon - it can't be that tough to add SD support, and your customers will be a heck of a lot happier!

title: Amazon Prime Music Streaming is Broken
author: The Bird Man
comments: Amazon's ability to stream music during peak hours when people are home is suspect. We have a fairly fast network, >6Mbps, and while playing music at home in the evenings the music plays, stops, plays, stops, ...etc.  During this time we tested the network and all other streaming apps and everything looked and worked perfect.Nothing else was running on our network except Amazon Prime Music. To stream music takes very little bandwidth compared to streaming an HD Movie.  This normally means a home network for playing music is rarely the problem and more likely to be something overloaded/broken in the providers network.

title: Yawn... Oh look, I can find ...
author: DCase
comments: Yawn... Oh look, I can find 10-20% of what interests me. I have diverse tastes, but Prime Music is VERY limited. Having 1,000,000 songs available must mean you have to buy the other 100,000,000. I signed up for Amazon Prime because of the value added content of prime music, prime video, and prime books, one of which i can't even access and the other two of which add negligable value. I am not renewing my prime membership (you will have to call to do this as the day you can, buy there is nowhere to do this on there site. Either that or they have it buried in a dark, inconspicuous corner of their site.Prediction... Prime is the beginning of the decline for Amazon. They have seen the pinacle of success and its going to be a long, hard ride down.

title: Find the Music in You!
author: Nick L.
comments: Only started listening this week. Downloaded the Andriod App and the PC App. I've easily found all my favorite bands and like the Channels and mixes they've  made. So far...So Good!

title: WHAT A WASTE OF MY LIFE!!!!!!
author: Jonathan Lake
comments: I have used this on a few occasions and it has worked fairly well. I come to use it this time and every time it makes me log back in there is no easy one click option on my amazon homepage to buy the mp3 I wanted. I had to search for it again then find that it was already in my mp3 basket but I couldnt get to my mp3 basket!!!!! Wasted an age on this........wait it continues.Then when I have bought it I try to download it to my computer and after updating a particular internet explorer it then tells me I need to down load amazon mp3 downloader, which I have but needs updating!!!!! So I update this then it after all that it no longer seems to let me download the song and I cant get it to come up on my newly updated amazon mp3 downloader!!!! WHAT IS THE POINT OF GIVING THIS MASSIVE MULTINATIONAL ANY OF MY MONEY IF THEY CANT SORT THIS BASIC THING OUT! VERY VERY VERY UNIMPRESSED!!!! I WILL STICK TO ITUNES FROM NOW ON

title: Amazon music
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Loved it just too expensive.

title: No need for iTunes now!!!
author: S. Sherwood
comments: I have been using this app on a Fire HDX, Samsung S5 and now a iPhone 6s. At first it was a little hard to understand, but now that I spent the time to learn it, I love it. I have never used the iTunes with my new phone. I have been able to load some of my old music to my library and plan to add more. The selection is always growing. You can download the music to the device so you can play it when offline as well. I had no problem with the app on my Kindle Fire as others have reported. It is true the music from prime is only able to be played in the prime player but that has never been an issue for me. Spend a little time, figure it out and I think most will find something to like.

title: The BEST in the BIZ
author: THyde
comments: I have Napster and ITunes as well as Amazon. By far, Amazon offers a wider choice, seamless downloads, easy playlist set-ups and tailors their weekly music choices to a "T" for my exact preferences. Not to mention, their sound quality FAR exceeds any other music app. PERIOD!!

title: Needs improvement
author: zachary
comments: It's okay, I like the x-ray lyrics function on most songs but wish they were on all of them . I also wish that when I look at the artist that there would be the entire discography not just a couple albums . I find the selection of music inadequate . When compared to Spotify Amazon prime music has a much inferior selection. I constantly have issues in which I cannot find a particular song, album, and/or artist I am looking for. Then to make it even worse many times when I'm looking for a particular song I find obnoxious remixes and covers that I want no part of.

title: Good app, good idea but lacking in content
author: duane wingell
comments: I primarily use Apple Music and some what am now a custom to the selection of music available in its store. Amazon music however, though is still relatively new lacks in up to date music, searching for popular music tends to yield no results which is slightly baffling. For this app to do well it needs to be able to take on its competitors and sadly doesn't quite do that. The app its self works lovely but without a good sizeable content library what's the point?

title: My go to music app.
author: katiemmoore25
comments: Prime Music has changed my life and I am so happy that I have this service and having this app makes it so easy to use! I have used some of the other apps out there to stream music and this is by far the best one yet and the one I use most frequently. I love that I can go back and forth between my library and between Amazon playlists and stations. I haven't had any problems with this app excessively draining my battery but I do however experience some crashes. But restarting the app usually fixes that and my music is back up and running in no time time. I highly recommend this app!

title: Confused by negative reviews
author: teariana
comments: I've been using this app for awhile on my Samsung Galaxy Ring and have no problem storing all my music in a file called music on my sdcard, while in the app you just click on "device" and it all comes up. I even have playlists, which although the list is set up in internal memory the music files remain in the ext sd file.  I did lose the playlists a couple of times but I think that was because I was using a memory cleaning program that I've since uninstalled because it also deleted some important files I had in what it considered an unimportant place. But everything works great, no need for Wi-Fi or data access to play anything downloaded to my ext sdcard. A for the refresh I've got it set up to do so only through Wi-Fi but even then it doesn't do it constantly, but that may be because I never use the cloud storage and/or cloud player.

title: Five Stars
author: John Givens
comments: Works well with my Samsung Galaxy! I have no complaints

title: Great selection, the feature of playing the songs you ...
author: Jessica Whtie
comments: Great selection, the feature of playing the songs you want without having to download them all is nice. The selection of genres of music is amazing and so is the new releases.I tell everyone i know about amazon music.

title: Excellent
author: Brandon
comments: Cancelled my spotify subscription and never looked back.  Excellent

title: Five Stars
author: scott
comments: best music app.....

title: NEEDS MORE SPANISH MUSIC ALL GENRE
author: Christina
comments: I would like more spanish music I search Spanish and i get like 3 titles of what knows what.  Then i search for an artist and its music is not prime etc.  I thought amazon serve all cultures but i guess not.  I still give it 3 stars because I like amazon but they can improve this app.

title: You need Mr. BozoÛªs permission to listen to your downloaded music
author: Top Reviewer 4 now
comments: Apparently Mr. ÛÏBozo,Û AMZ founder and CEO, is a control freak who thinks he owns your music library, even after you have purchased and downloaded all of the songs. It is often not possible to open up Amazon Music to listen to your (downloaded) music without logging into Amazon (e.g. whenever they have a software update or just want to check up on you). ItÛªs not a stand alone player, so if you are offline and away from an Internet connection, you maybe out of luck.I finally switched to iTunes, which is not set up this way. Apple believes that after you have purchased the music, you do not need their permission to listen to it!

title: Meh
author: Robert W. Gregory
comments: Only works after you google how to fix

title: Fix the app
author: Jena Bahnsen-Wright
comments: I would give it no stars if allowed as I am unable to download the app or access any of my music I have purchased within the last eight years!

title: Easy app
author: Dustin
comments: Easy to use plenty of mainstream options

title: Needs a lot of update and collection is low at this time.
author: Indraneil Joshi
comments: For Bollywood songs, instrumental music, Eastern Classical etc and for music with different Indian languages, collection needs a lot of updates. Collection is pretty small. I am sure if more customers demand, Amazon will update it soon. Looking forward to it.

title: Double charged for music
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I added a song on Amazon Prime Music (New Person, Same Old Mistakes by Tame Impala), then cancelled my Amazon Prime, so as expected I can no longer play that song. But then I purchased the entire MP3 album (Currents by Tame Impala) for $5.99 which is supposed to include that song (track 13), however, the Amazon music app still wouldn't let me play it! I had to pay an extra $1.29 to purchase that song, which is ridiculous because I already paid for the album and that track should have been included in the purchase.

title: Best thing ever
author: queenT
comments: Best thing ever. I always wondered if I could take my music with me from my kindle fire. I love it!

title: Three Stars
author: Tenax
comments: I like the features this application has but sometimes does not operate correctly.

title: Look out Beatsã¢, Amazon's giving you a run for your money!
author: CBordeezy
comments: This app is great! I can't believe it took me so long to find it. It offers everything I look for in a Music App.+ MUCH MORE! I recommend it to anyone who hasn't tried it. Appealing look, easy to use, every artist you could think of, great interface, loads of growing potential, off-line options, the last just goes on& on.

title: Best Music App!
author: Tyla
comments: Best way to get music! No commercials, all the music genre's. I love it and the app is easy to use!

title: In my opinion the sound does not match Pandora or ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: In my opinion the sound does not match Pandora or for that matter even  I Heart Radio. The quality is not there uncomfortable to listen to transistor radio type

title: Why does it only save to the primary phone card?
author: Wolf4020
comments: Downloaded this program to my Galaxy Note 2. Thought "WOW this is better than Pandora, Can pick the songs I want to hear!"BUT - It turns out we can't save the music to the Installed SD card. Everything goes to the internal memory. What good is that! I have a 64gb card installed because I use my phone often more than my laptop. So I can nibble away at my data plan when not near a Wi-Fi or not bother with this system. Unless they update this issue soon I think most of us are throwing it away! Come on Amazon, You can let it send to the SD card. PLEASE!

title: needs some work, not seamless with the Firestick TV
author: alexisd3000
comments: I am thrilled that there are so many offerings from Prime music, but disappointed that when playing the songs with my Amazon Firestick.  When using Amazon Music on the Firestick TV the play/pause, forward, and reverse buttons on my remote do nothing, unlike Pandora.  I also noticed that unlike Pandora on the Firestick TV, the artist and titles of the songs don't pop up when changing if in another app.  Seems Amazon did much less developing on this than Pandora did.  The playback seems to end songs prematurely every once in a while, too.  I have yet to try to access this library from a mobile device, I hope it works.

title: play some R&B from the 1970's (or whatever period I feel like at the time) and she does it
author: DHelms53
comments: I use this with Alexa and just have to say Alexa, play some R&B from the 1970's (or whatever period I feel like at the time) and she does it!  Great tunes.

title: It is especially bad if, like me
author: Nello
comments: This software is not ready for prime. It is especially bad if, like me, you have a large music collection. I paid for the larger storage capacity, but so far I have not been able to upload even the amount I am allowed for free. The uploader constantly crashes. Then you have to restart and deal with all the duplicates from the first attempt.  If I can't get my thousands of tracks uploaded, this will be of little use to me. The only reason I bought the space in the cloud was so that my new Amazon Echo (which works MUCH better) could access most of my music collection. If I can't get the collection into the library in the first place, what's the point?

title: Good in theory, poor execution.
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Got the app for a trip hoping to have music while in flight.  Unfortunately, the app pauses music every 15-20 seconds while using a Bluetooth connection.  Luckily my headset has a cord available to use as well, so I wasn't completely at a loss.  Upon returning home, I found to my dismay that it does the same on all Bluetooth connections, both of our personal vehicles as well as my work truck.  Unfortunately I'm going to return to Pandora.

title: Used to be easy to use and lots of fun
author: Elaine
comments: Once again, overthought.  Used to be easy to use and lots of fun.  It is now virtually a nightmare to navigate.  Amazon, this works against users purchasing additional items, which I assume to be the point.  Geeks aren't users.  Geeks just want to add complications.  You should really start paying attention to users.

title: Amazing service - give it a go!!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I have been using a lot of the music streaming services but this particular service from Amazon I like much better because of several factors:1- The amazon prime subscription allows me to listen to unlimited music of my liking and get awesome deals at amazon!2- The stream quality is great, no pauses or lags3- The service is basic and easy to use and has a wide selection of music, playlists and features to suit any needs!

title: I really love Amazon prime music and the selection of music and ...
author: Teri Black
comments: I really love Amazon prime music and the selection of music and playlists I have to choose from. That being said, I am very disappointed that I cannot choose whether to put the music on my internal drive or my sd card. I cannot get Internet or cell service at my job so streaming from the cloud is out of the question and playing my music offline from the internal memory just seems to run my battery down faster. Not to mention the amount of memory my music takes up. It just frustrates me to no end. I will keep the service because I order a lot of products from Amazon and for Amazon Kindle but I hope that they take all the negative feedback into account about the music memory problems and do something about it.

title: One Star
author: joshua
comments: not a big fan of amazon music i dont like there ui layout

title: Amazon Changes Cloud Player with no notice
author: Dulcie
comments: Went to use my Amazon Cloud Player this morning and found that my desktop shortcut no longer worked--searched for "cloud player" and of course could not find it....as the name had changed.  It took me a while to search and find that Amazon has changed/upgraded the app and changed its name.  Thought about downloading the new version....but would it overwrite all of my existing playlists?  LOTS of those to lose.  Also there were references to fees and charges for the new version of the player.  Called customer service and of course got transferred around before getting the information I need.What an unnecessary waste of time.  Instead of sending me an email before the switch, touting the latest features (and more selling opportunities for Amazon),  they made me mad, wasted their customer service agents' time, and BTW, I STILL don't know what the new features are.Useful to know: you cannot export a playlist from this player, or even print one for reference.

title: Five Stars
author: Fredzo
comments: Easy setup, great selection.  Bye-bye S$$$$US!

title: Good application for local and cloud-base music playing...
author: Long-Suffering Technology Consumer
comments: Music library synchronization for Droid users: solved. Woo hoo...Since becoming an Android user I've been tolerant of "good enough" music synchronization capabilities offered by other applications (including the upgrade/pro version ofåÊWinampåÊand doubleTwist. One (Winamp) was good enough, while doubleTwist had serious issues that led me to uninstall and look for other solutions.The turn to Amazon MP3 came when Amazon added its "AutoRip" service to user accounts. In short: if you were already using Amazon's cloud player (I was), they added the tracks from any CDs purchased from Amazon (since 1998) to your cloud player list. Since I had already made an "Amazon over iTunes store" decsion earlier, this became an ideal solution for me. Essentially, all music I've ever purchased from Amazon is available in cloud streaming and .mp3 formats (and presumably I still have the physical media from CD purchases, which are not so frequent in my house these days).As for the player itself: it quickly indexed the .mp3 contents of my phone and flawlessly accesses my cloud content (network connections permitting). It automatically switches between Bluetooth and headphones, depending on the what I'm playing the music to. The interface is uncluttered and intuitive. Once you've made the decision to turn control of your music inventory over to Amazon...the rest is easy!

title: If not using prime music, look elsewhere.
author: Jim W.
comments: If it weren't for the Prime music, I wouldn't use this app. There is very limited control over the play back.Some key features I feel are lacking:*Ability to view/edit now playing queue. I don't want to have to create a playlist every time I want to play songs in a certain order. Google Play music executes this much better.*Swipe to change songs*Ability to set save location for music.Pros:Ability to limit streaming and downloading to WiFi only.Ability to quickly switch between locally stored music and cloud music.

title: Wth
author: hightower  snotspicket
comments: Anything and everything you want to hear. Well except I could find tip type through the tulips tip tow  through the tulips spell check won't let me type tis. T o e

title: Getting a striped bar instead of music.
author: Kindle Customer
comments: Wouldn't download to my itunes file anymore even after giving it the right directory(it used to), then stopped working entirely. Now I gotta contact tech support, but other sources of music have me putting that odyssey off. Even when working, it was hard to navigate. I still love Amazon, and will buy music for my Kindle, but this aggravated me.

title: Great App for Amazon Cloud
author: charles corum
comments: I have over 1,500 albums (18,000 "songs") on my iMac, and decided to upgrade the Amazon Cloud player from the free 250 "song"-limit to the 250,000(!) "song"-limit ($25/year) so I could download my music to my Android phone, without putting any data on the phone itself (which wouldn't hold a fraction of this much data anyway)."Songs" is in quotes, because most of my collection is classical, so a "song" could be less than a minute, to over 30 minutes in a symphony movement.It took FOREVER (well, 5 days) to download all this to the cloud, as the computer kept going to sleep if not monitored, but it went smoothly, and now I don't have to also carry my iPod with me on trips. I also liked the fact that Amazon bumps the bps from the 192 max on Apple, to 256. With a good pair of headphones you can hear the difference.I also REALLY liked the fact that Amazon gives you the album art, unlike Apple, which nickels-and-dimes you for everything ($1 for album art? Whose idea was this?) Some of the covers are different/newer than those that came with the original CDs.

title: never again
author: Tiffany
comments: its doesnt have the songs i want and you cant play them without wifi

title: Nice selection, I have it on a couple of ...
author: Prodiglbud
comments: Nice selection, I have it on a couple of devices, only problem is they're not synced together through amazon music.

title: The latest update is awful
author: brian hoggard
comments: The new redesign is terrible. I have no idea where to go to see the most popular songs, and have no clue where to make purchases. All that I can see are the Top Prime Songs. Where are the songs available to purchase?

title: unless I waste my time with different workarounds
author: Mark Glinski
comments: With every iteration, this app becomes less and less intuitive and more frustrating to work with. I have a lot of classical music, and it is organized in a way that makes it almost impossible for me to play a single album, unless I waste my time with different workarounds. And now, uploading music requires an awkward manual process. Also I agree with another reviewers who says the app is intrusive. I am seriously reevaluating whether I want to continue using Amazon products (the Kindle is terrible, too).

title: I love that I can use this as opposed to Itunes
author: mts3857
comments: I love that I can use this as opposed to Itunes.  I absolutely use this over apple and love it.

title: The quality of sound is not very good. It is compressed and lacks dynamics resulting in ...
author: Signed Unhappy
comments: The quality of sound is not very good. It is compressed and lacks dynamics resulting in lifeless,flat audio image. I  enjoy the sound of quality reproduction and this is not quality.  Additionally, music selection is very limited.  Amazon continues to negotiate for cheap licensing fees and it shows in their product.

title: Music
author: Ashford
comments: Love the musicAshford

title: If you have played a song and want to go ...
author: Ms. B
comments: If you have played a song and want to go back after the next song has played then you do not have the option to scroll back. Other than that, it does everything that Pandora does, without the additional cost.

title: Works good on my samsung phone
author: gary a koubek
comments: Works well and is stable so far , no complaints

title: Three Stars

comments: All the musics were taken an away after my subscription was over

title: Don't waste your time.
author: Shelly
comments: If I could give it a zero I would. This thing does not work. I tried it on my laptop and my phone. Neither version would play the songs I purchased, if it even showed them at all. I'm going back to buying CDs. They may require storage space, but at least they work.

title: Buggy, slow, awful
author: almagpie
comments: I love Amazon but your apps are the worst pieces of rubbish ever coded. Slow, buggy, almost unusable. I'm trying to edit a cloud playlist before downloading, I drag one song and the whole program hangs for 5 minutes while it does something (rewrite a pointer chain maybe? who knows) but it's a long painful process. On the phone it's no better, even playing something takes up to a minute to load the playlist and start playing. Why, Amazon, why?

title: Great service?
author: Seadog
comments: WTF!  I have been a prime member since the service started...the Prime music sounds great... that seems to be where the great stops...added a few playlists, then tried to find the playlists... a list of crap and nowhere to be seen are the playlists that I added.click on "Your Music Library >" takes me to.... nowhere!Oh, wait!  It only works on my PHONE!  not on the computer, not on the Sonos unit I purchased fromAmazon.... Crap!Hey guys, when you make it work with more of the devices I actually use,  let me know.  It may even make it move to 2 stars!I love Amazon Prime, but as it stands this 'service' holds almost '0' value for me.

title: Update 5.4.3 turns off my wifi, deleted app and wifi works again perfectly..  why???
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I am downgrading this app because the latest update 5.4.3 affected my wifi connectivity on my Blackberry Priv. Couldn't understand why my wifi kept disconnecting by itself. Deleted this app and now it works perfectly again.  Notes for the update says it controls wifi connections.  Wish you hadn't done that, I enjoyed playing the music on my phone.

title: This is about the Desktop application
author: Jake
comments: Problem: "Amazon Music Helper" application runs in the background, chewing up a non-insignificant amount of CPU time.No idea why a "helper" app needs to run, unless amazon is using a P2P system.I didn't check my network usage, but the CPU utilization was enough to merit deletion.

title: Amazon Music Ap
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Easy to use, would recommend

title: I was delighted when i realized I could download music for offline ...
author: cdjflyslow
comments: while this app does give access to a lot of free music, its very confusing sorting between your cloud library, offline library, and Prime music. I was delighted when i realized I could download music for offline playback. But once I did, I quickly found out it was using internal storage and  there is no way to change that. So that pretty much blew it for that feature.  Also the app just quits almost every time I get a call, or an alarm goes off or anything. I have to restart it and work my way back to what I was enjoying. Also it got locked into repeat mode somehow and it would only play the first song in any album. Had to re-install to fix it.  I think Amazon needs to revamp/simplify this app and allow Prime downloads to the SC card.

title: Need to be able to select Music Download Folder
author: Brodie
comments: I loved this app at first but now that I'm buying and downloading more music I want to be able to place the music in a folder on my External SD card. This app however does not let you choose the location where you want your files stored. So, I'm quickly running out of space to download the music files.Not having just this one feature makes me give this one star, even though the rest of the app works pretty darn good.  Come on Amazon get with it and add this one feature!

title: I like amazon music much
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I like  amazon music much, the only neg thing about is it's hard to find and up lode  the best songs from an artist it seems with some you can'tand with others you can if you look blow artist and station there are some album choices up to usually 4 some time 1 or 3 and some artist you can only get amazon prime unless go to store purchase.

title: i loved my Amazon Prime Music intensely until the latest update
author: Nancy S. Elwell
comments: i loved my Amazon Prime Music intensely until the latest update. I have a playlist that lasts for 10 hours and i set it to play when i'm ready to sleep. Still playing when i wake up. NOW, if i wake up in the middle of the night, its paused and a message says i haven't been paying attention and do I want to continue playing music, or some crap like that. I called Amazon. They were , as always, very polite but said they can't fix this feature of the update, but many people had complained.

title: Junk
author: zippy
comments: Since installing it a few years ago the pc version of this ap has been a necessary evil but basically a cumbersome piece of trash.The new version was forced on me 10/13/16. It doesn't work. Eating up all my pcs resources, it crawls. At best it plays one song then freezes.Time to rethink my prime membership.

title: Does Amazon Prime hide the good Music in Amazon Music Unlimited?
author: Mike Mercer
comments: Great music, but I find the lack of many artists' music discouraging unless I PAY more by adding Amazon Music Unlimited.And, you can't click on the notice to add AMU either....seems they'd make it easy to buy it.I can use Google Play for free if I put up with an add every 5 or 6 songs...short ads too.

title: Needs work
author: JC
comments: My Lord, where do I start with this app.  How about it removed the ability to edit your songs?  Or how about absolutely wrong artwork?  A kicker for me is the offline music.  There is no way to import songs into Amazon Music.  It "scans" using settings you configured in "Preferences".  It refuses to add any songs from my home NAS.  Some features are OK, like any purchased music immediately show up in the online library.  But the rest of the functionality totally sucks.

title: Would expect more
author: felix
comments: Not all music is accesible. Have to pay (again) for music not available under Prime. Woukd expect more after paying for prime

title: Amazon Music with Prime is amazing!
author: Dawn Edmonds
comments: This has to be one of the best music programs I've ever had the pleasure of using. It is very easy to operate and pretty much self explanatory. Searching for music & downloading it is a breeze, and you also have the option of placing tracks in your Amazon cloud. With this feature you are able to access your music from anywhere without necessarily having to use up needed space on your device. The best feature I've found is that the music library. It is so extensive that u can find just about anything that you can imagine, and if you have a Prime membership, most if them are free. It's awesome...I will almost certainly never have to look anywhere else for my music needs.

title: This app worked fine for a while
author: C. Apicella
comments: This app worked fine for a while.  Now I get a lot of split second stuttering in the songs to the point that I am unable to listen.  Songs that I have purchased through Amazon and songs I have had before I got the app work fine.  Anything that I have downloaded free as part of my Prime Membership stutter.  So frustrating.  Customer service told me to clear the cache then to unload and reload the app.  Did it twice.  Still having problems.  Amazon?  Amazon?  anyone home out there?

title: Five Stars

title: Too complicated

comments: Prime music is too complicated.Can't figure out how to make it work.I don't want to "add to my library" - not interested.Just want search - get a list, say play and listen for 3 hours.Plus how much javascript do we need to allow from 3rd parties for this to work?  I'm careful to NOT allow 3rd party javascript - what is this "cloudfront" place?  A hacker website?  Has amazon been hacked?Lastly, I'd love to use prime music with our roku, so security issues aren't my problem.Someday I hope to be smart enough to get this working on my Ubuntu Linux desktop - ah ... someday.

title: Amazon apparently doesn't know when the 80's were.
author: JM
comments: Amazon Prime music has the stations so you can choose which genre of music you want to listen to, cool.  I like 80's music, so i was excited to see an 80's Pop station.  I started listening to it being diligent to rate the music I like vs the stuff I don't like, then all of a sudden I start hearing artists like Justin Timberlake, Avril Lavigne and Jason Mraz.  WTF Amazon.  Do you guys not know when the 80's were?  How hard is it to write code that tells the station, if the song wasn't released between 1980 and 1989 then it's not 80's music....Your stations suck, and i'm going back to the free Pandora.  I'd rather listen to a 30 second add than music that doesn't make sense.

author: Amanda J.
comments: Uses A LOT of RAM on Android smartphones, and drains the battery like nobody's business. It plays my Prime music library well enough, but I don't foresee myself running this battery hog much, which sucks because I'd like to listen to my library from my phone.
