comments: Cool App for my phone.

title: Consistently fails to play albums that are on/in the Prime library.
author: Muffin
comments: Constantly failing to play music that is currently available in the prime library (items NOT grayed out)  This has been happening consistently for weeks now.  Amazon keeps saying they are working on a solution for the issue, but no info beyond that.  From my own searches, this is the response they have been giving for months.  Very frustrating.

title: Three Stars
author: brad
comments: Great app. Not crazy about last update. Drains battery ALOT

title: Great app but confusing
author: Dennis
comments: Cool app, it's a bit confusing though as to the difference between just selecting "add to library" when choosing a free CD (because it's a Prime CD) or selecting "download" CD. If I download something that's free because of my Prime membership, what happens if/when my Prime membership expires? Do the songs disappear or stop working then or what? Why offer to let me buy the CD if I can download it for free?  I guess I need to read the FAQ page or something but this is very confusing.

title: Pays for itself in free shipping alone.
author: Karl W.
comments: Works great while you have it but I let my Prime account elapsed  and at the moment I don't have the extra $99 to be able to subscribe for another year and don't have access to all my music that I downloaded. Had I known this I would have uploaded it to another cloud or downloaded it to my USB drive. I never got the chance to watch any of the free movies but I'm sure they were good as others have stated. I do miss the Free shipping which now really sucks.lol

title: Thanks
author: Kathy Banks
comments: Just started using it.

title: Come on Amazon, you can do better than this...
author: Joe K.
comments: Ever since the most recent rounds of updates, I can stream effortlessly, but if I have downloaded the song, it will just spin for as long as I let it without playing the song. Very annoying.

title: Not Good
author: D. Zorn
comments: App is too huge and clumsy. Very hard to find recently purchased music. Automatically includes songs from cd's I purchased years ago and have no interest in including in my current library. Keeps pushing for Prime Music which I do not want. If I don't have it, get it off the app. All the different lists are too much. Some don't even make any sense.

title: I think the software is generally good with one significant exception
author: Mr. J. Ballard
comments: I think the software is generally good with one significant exception.  Getting a recurrent 'unable to copy file' message attempting to download pushed system updates is frustrating in the extreme (Grrrrrrrrr!).  Post suggest that suspending antivirus software (in my case BullGuard) during the re/install resolves this problem but it doesn't; nor should the software be designed in a fashion that requires this type of unsafe system prerequisite.

title: cool
author: Amazon Customer
comments: idk, it worksthe widget is nice too

title: Amazon Prime Music in Bose Soundwave System
author: Sunset 27
comments: Finally Amazon Music is available in Bose Sound Wave system I'm waiting for two years and today downloaded the Amazon Music App for use together with the Bose App fantastic . Thanks I.P.

title: I use my amazon music ALL the time!
author: angelacez
comments: I quit using my Pandora and iheartradio when I realized how great it was.  I've had prime for a year.  I wish I'd started using it sooner!

title: No longer works!!!!!!
author: Slaw
comments: Can I give a zero star review? Today, I received notice to upgrade app. Once I did, I can no longer upload songs. What??????? Fix this app!

title: Amazing
author: Jzackial Reviews
comments: What an amazing benefit and reason to get Prime. Tons of artists, plenty of space to add songs and create play lists. The x-ray lyrics is a great feature as well and follows the song pretty well. At times the x-ray lyrics can lag behind the song but Im pretty sure this is because Im listening via blutooth in my car (happens on utube as well). Overall its an amazing music player with tons of free music and pre programmed stations. Highly recommended!

title: They keep taking music away.
author: Ziggpop
comments: I have had Prime a little over a year now and it seems like every time I save albums to my library and go to listen to them later on, about a third of what I originally saved is no longer available unless I want to upgrade. Not much of a benefit if you ask me.

title: Its good.
author: Bayou Boy
comments: Its pretty good I must say. I barely use it though to say a lot. I remember having a issue. That's why I give it only four stars.

title: Worst music player I have ever used
author: Finn
comments: Worst music player I have ever used. I am a prime member and I won't even use it. It's not worth the frustration. I'd rather listen to SpotifyÛÜ adds than struggle to use Amazon Music.

title: Vast selection of music and artists!
author: As I See It
comments: I listen at my desk through the Tap. The music selection is vast, from stations to albums and artists, there is something for everyone. A great alternative to radio especially if you have poor reception inside.

title: Amazon mp3 Player for Android won't download to sd card
author: Shelster
comments: I love the Amazon mp3 player! It's easy to use & I love having my entire music collection right there on the cloud for download anytime I like. The app is large but it allows you to move it your phone's sd card. Which is nice because my phone's internal storage is limited. However... I bought a 32gb sd card for my Droid X2 to have more room for music only to realize, after downloading a good portion of desired tracks from my extensive cloud music collection, that Amazon mp3 player will only download to my phone's internal storage. How can this be rectified???

title: It sure ain't Spotify
author: Quality Counts
comments: Please, I beg you....STOP SALES PITCHING ME! Popups, sample music clips, offers to buy music, but no music. Seriously...you guys should stick to what you do best. And this ain't it!

title: Five Stars
author: Craig Mcclain
comments: Thanks

title: Very buggy app
author: William S.
comments: I just cant seem to make this app work! It is extremely sluggish, at times not showing the music. The download function seems hard to access. Keeps showing 'Loading songs' but never seems to finish loading. Don't think it's my phone, I am using a Samsung S3. You would think that would be more than enough processing power to run this app? There have been numerous app updates, but none is better than the previous one. I would much rather use Google Play than this music app, it's much more functional and stable.

title: Five Stars
author: Raymond
comments: listen to it very often the oldies and the new it's great

title: It is missing many favorites from each of the last 5 decades.
author: mrgillard
comments: Without the upgraded Amazon Prime Music account, the regular Amazon music is missing many of my favorites from each of the last 5 decades.  It is especially thin in the 70's and 80's music, with a few people I like having only one available song from an album without upgrading to Prime Music, or paying for individual tracks.  The comedy is also weak.

title: It makes me very sad. And frustrated and more frustrated
author: Maria
comments: I tell people that Amazon is my "crack"...I'm currently going through withdrawals and it stinks!  The app crashed on my computer and I can't function without it during the day!  I've now spent over an hour of time trying to get the app up and running.  It makes me very sad. And frustrated and more frustrated!

title: Good app, but...
author: Ivy
comments: The player performs flawlessly, but does so only from the phones internal storage.  More importantly I cannot find an option for storing downloaded music to any alternate locations.  I have manually moved my music to a newly installed SD card.  I hope the player will see the music there.  If so, all will be well.  The player itself can happily reside on the phones internal storage while the data rich music is on the SD card.  The only other ding I have on this app is the equalizer.  I wish it was more sophisticated.

title: not for phones more than 2 years old
author: bullittchase
comments: I used android 2.2.2 and this app is too advanced for my "ancient" phone.  Even though every other major competing music app is available on my phone.  How advanced does an app need to be just to play music?  Basically this app requires more advanced technology than was needed to land a person on the moon.  Ridiculous.  Amazon acting like Apple again.

title: Brilliant with no commercials!
author: Ricardo Pazos
comments: I use the stations with my android phone casting to my car receiver connected by blue tooth. Streaming is ver good even when 2bars 3g connection is available. Better then Pandora when you already have prime with Amazone.

title: Five Stars
author: Kevin K.
comments: YOU KNOW your the best

title: Love the music
author: David's gal
comments: Awesome songs

title: Two Stars
author: Kael
comments: 500 song limit on playlists makes this fundamentally fail at its purpose. Would be 4-5 stars otherwise most likely.

title: My digital music and cloud player
author: laura collins
comments: I love my cloud storage and player. I have bought many mp3 downloads from several media services and have lost all my money when my phone or mp3 player was lost or broken. But with my Amazon digital purchases they are stored free on my cloud and I can get them anytime anywhere and play them on the web. I dont feel like Im wasting my money because I will always have the music I bought and even other music downloads that I already had on my computer because I can import the songs I didnt buy from Amazon. I even get free songs from Amazon that I didnt ask for and its music I love. Its great to know my jams are safe and secure and will always be there when I want it. Thanks Amazon Digital.

title: How to find this app in the appstore...
author: Mira
comments: I just downloaded this on my Fire phone and it's currently loading from the cloud, so I can't speak to it's performance yet but I do want to let you guys know that you have to type in "Amazon Prime" in the search bar rather than just "prime," or else it doesn't come up.  I called Mayday because I couldn't find the app and he couldn't find it either.  Hopefully this will prevent some frustration amongst people having the same problem.

title: One of the best apps ever
author: Tip
comments: One of the best apps ever.  I have used this for quite some time.  If you are a Prime member it is a must have, especially since it's free.  You have access to thousands of songs from every genre of music.  You can create a library and store all of your favorite artists.  You can also download the music to your device in case you are on airplane mode on vacation or whatever.  You can also listen to stations, similar to Pandora, except there are no ads.

title: Total waste of Time
author: Skimamma
comments: Spent hours going through their catalog and creating a playlist to find out that contrary to their claim you can't download any prime music onto your computer (oh sorry that's wrong, out of the 45 songs I put in my playlist I was able to download a whooping 2 songs.) So, the small MP3 player I just purchased on the Amazon website to use while I am running, the MP3 player that just plays music files and doesn't load apps, the MP3 player that I will now be returning to Amazon, is totally useless. They should show this information in big bold letters from the get go instead of leading you to believe that you can download music onto your PC. YOU CANNOT DOWNLOAD ANY PRIME MUSIC FILES ONTO YOUR COMPUTER. So, really not sure why they are calling these songs you can't download "Prime music", certainly makes it seem as though you as a "Prime member" would have access is a bunch of crap. I guess they are trying to justify the $99.00 a year fee they charge by giving you what amounts to another Pandora or Spotify. What a waste of time, and now I have an app I have to uninstall as well or maybe I should just run with my Kindle strapped to the side of my head.

title: Good app.
author: Richard
comments: Use it daily.  All good.

title: Ripoff!!
author: Sean Sudduth
comments: Already paying for songs. The most recent update wants another $120 a year on top of that . No thanks.

title: good luck. Hardly any selection for music you don't ...
author: paul kirsey
comments: It's ridiculously convoluted to use.  If you're searching for a specific band or artist, good luck.  Hardly any selection for music you don't have to pay more money for.  Even what's available to buy is pathetic.  I've tried to use this app for a couple weeks to see if it got better by learning how to use it but no.  It's useless.

title: No widget? UPDATE: there is a widget
author: Charles
comments: Most recent update killed my widget for this app. Please fix ASAP. Other than that I enjoy the app. It's simple to use and I like having my music library handy wherever I may be.UPDATE:  I have recently moved the app from my SD card back to the phone.  There is a limitation to the Android operation system that doesn't allow widgets if it is on your SD card.  After doing this I was able to use the widget once again.  I have upgraded the rating from 3 stars to 4 stars.  I do wish that the player had the ability to let me customize the equalizer to my tastes rather than the preset ones that they have.  Lately I have been creating playlists in Amazon and then using the cubed (3) player to play them as the sound is better through that player.Using Droid Incredible 2.

title: Five Stars
author: LINDY
comments: works as described.

title: Why Amazon?
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Amazon screwed up.I want to be able to listen to my music with ease, and not worry about accidentally purchasing music.The screen for purchasing amazon prime has an error where you cannot click "not now".Why Amazon why?! You had something gold and s*** on it.Please do not download because it is a waste of time. The old version was 100% better.Amazon MP3= GreatAmazon Music= Windows 8

title: oh, hell, no!...really, Amazon?
author: Tammy Minton Haley
comments: ...cannot access my Prime music on the Roku App...seems like these Prime Membership bonuses have tangled strings attached...can't use the Amazon Music App to stream Prime music...extremely difficult to access the Kindle benefits...incredibly ridiculous AppStore download process...very limited selection of Prime movies, even less television...unless something changes, i cannot see myself renewing...free shipping is everywhere...get over yourself, Amazon...

title: Waste of money and time!
author: rrrtjm
comments: Unhappy... I want this cancelled effective immediately!

title: Amazon Prime Music is life.
author: Robyn Dianne
comments: I am obsessed with Amazon Prime Music or what ever I'm supposed to call it. I downloaded the apps on all of my devices (MacBook, iPhone, iPad). I constantly have something playing and there's always something new for me to enjoying. Being a Prime Member has never been more rewarding! I wish I had started using Amazon Prime Music right away!!

title: Mind-numbingly slow. (OSX Version: 4. 0. ...
author: Brad Kinder
comments: Mind-numbingly slow. (OSX Version: 4.0.0.949.4.0.2.570)I am only using it to build a few playlists for my Echo. I have to wait up a minute to be able to move a song to a playlist after moving another song.

title: Good deal
author: Jorgy1911
comments: Prime music is great is set up for phones loads of free music of your choice. Takes a while to learn how to access it in app but is good. Cannot access this from anything but phones or Amazon products tried to use on roku will not play my music unless you have purchased music and that is all you get just purchased. I understand promoting your products ,kindle ,fire stick etc but we all do not just have Amazon products. Would have given it 5 star rating otherwise

title: Bluetooth issues
author: Robert Wilkens
comments: Seems streaming to a car radio with bt, that songs are broken into 3 to 5 second clips, and there are a lot of hiccups.  Almost want to ask for partial refund on amazon prime, as this replacing pandora was part of cost justification for prime.  Support at amazon acknowledged this as a known issue, if they fix it i will revisit this review.

title: Still Needs Improvement
author: Dianne A. Thurman
comments: Have always had problems withÛÜ Your Music app

title: Awesome!
author: 2yorkiemama
comments: I've been using Pandora for several years.  As a Prime member I decided to take advantage of this and give it a try.  I really LOVE it.... I picked several artists to create different genres.  It's excellent at the selections it gives.  You can still thumbs up or down and/or skip.  And NO commercials!  Definitely worth it.  I may just give up my subscription to Pandora :)

title: Most counter-intuitive of any music apps.  Terrible.
author: Thresher Klier
comments: This is for the Amazon Prime Music for the Samsung Galaxy S6.... absolutely terrible.  The most counter-intuitive of any music services I have encountered.  The search mechanism is impossible - the stations are difficult to manage and good lord turning the thing OFF takes an act of congress.  I struggled for a few hours while watching a movie and just decided to uninstall the app.  Too bad - Amazon does so many things well.

title: Three Stars
author: L  Pierleoni
comments: Good selections

title: Frustrating!
author: History Buff
comments: Not cool. Can't play music I BOUGHT except on the app. Even though I downloaded the music I bought, I can't play it offline. No more buying music on Amazon, I guess.

title: Excellent---Better than Pandora
author: JF
comments: I listen to this every day at work and on my phone when walking the dog.  The music selection is vast and varied.  The Prime Stations are better than Pandora.  I have even used it to play music for our Oktoberfest celebration.  I have yet to find anything bad about it. The only problem I encountered is that I downloaded so many songs that I ran out of memory on my phone and had to delete some.  They are, however, still in my library in the cloud.  I enjoy the recommendations that are listed based on the music I am listening too.  As a result I have found artists I would not have looked into otherwise.  I highly recommend the service!!!

title: worthless junk!
author: Joey R. Kong
comments: I finally got this piece of junk app to start working with my PC after 45mins of messing with setting for my firewall, antivirus, and windows media player. Only to find out I downloaded my entire song purchase 3 times (like 150 songs)---guess what!? I cannot remove songs!!! So I have to download 450 songs to get my 150 songs, piece of crap!! Yeah it was my fault for clicking to download my queue 3 times while trouble shooting, but no choice to stop downloading, or remove songs. SUCKTASTIC, MORONIC, SIMPLISTIC, GARBAGE! Plus I read a lot of the other negative reviews, and they seem to be accurate. I only give it 2 stars because right now technically speaking it is working (and I have a 9mbs connection) SO it's only going to waste a few hours of my time.

title: Incredibly slow downloads
author: Dione Greywolfe
comments: I love the prices and collections of classical, New Age and other genres of music available from Amazon. I just can't believe how incredibly slow downloads to my Windows Media Player program on my PC is.I have 100 Must-Have Vivaldi...downloading now and it's been going for 15 minutes and still isn't finished. I looked for an option that would allow direct downloads to my MP3 device. Not there! I have a sattelite ISP that's very fast with any other download I choose--but not this app.

title: Fantastic
author: Thomas Murawski
comments: I use my Kindle Fire at home to listen to music. Now I just grab my phone and get in the car and hook up with the blue tooth and have all my music with me. It's the same simple format as the Kindle and I can play right out of the cloud without having any music on my phone and all. I read all the reviews complaining about the app size. And I'm surprised that people so tech savvy have not figured out why they can't get the music to their SD cards. It's a business process, not a personal issue, or a technical aspect.I suggest they should put down their phones and live life a bit. Maybe even put a soundtrack to it.

title: Three Stars
author: Del B
comments: You have to pay to get some songs.

title: User-Antagonistic App that doesn't CARE if you want to download your library efficiently
author: David Valdez
comments: I keep trying to love this app. Yes, they did improve it, but it STILL won't let me download ALL of my music from the cloud to my computer. I KNOW that Amazon wants us enslaved to their cloud, but the reality is that Internet connections are not as reliable as Amazon believes. Could this be because Amazon lives in a wired city? See, I live in Portland, OR and we are very wired, too. HOWEVER, crap happens and with the Amazon Music app, you either download EACH album individually, which is tedious if you already have a large music library, OR you suck it up, Buttercup, and use the cloud. When is Amazon finally going to tell their sweatshop developers to have a "Download All" option in the app so that those of us who want to listen regardless of our ISP's current availability?!I'm sorry, but this is about as user-antagonistic an app as I've seen in a VERY long time, and I'm specifically talking about the new player, not some old one.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Just learned of Amazon Music and like it a lot.

title: Five Stars
author: Hope Main
comments: Love it! Perfect!

title: One Star
author: K L
comments: I'm not going to get it due the other comments.

title: Excellent evolution
author: Eric Sinclair
comments: I've had and used earlier iterations of the Amazon MP3 Application on my android devices before, but the continued evolution - and integration with general Amazon features - is promising and pleasing. Being able to access both local and remote music files from a single application is an excellent step forward, though it'd be a bit better if they could be in one general listing (challenging as that might be to represent).This could easily become the 'daily driver' player, but like other reviewers I'd love to see two additions:1/ integration with the lock screen (ala Songbird)2/ Support for the scrobbling standards (e.g. with Last.FM or third party scrobblers).Putting these in a review is... unlikely to get a response, but a quick look around I couldn't see how best to add enhancement requests directly.

title: Had to uninstall
author: Master Tim
comments: The new version with the prime music library seems great. Unfortunately when I tried to play a song I just got a revolving circle over the play button, which would not go away. It slowed down the phone completely, drained the battery in minutes and caused it to overheat. I had to uninstall it. Samsung Galaxy II. I repeated it several times to make sure something else wasn't responsible.

title: I had used what I can of this music app ...
author: Juan J Guevara
comments: I had used what I can of this music app with my Amazon Fire Phone, but I feel Amazon is treating the owner of their Fire phones as second class. I can stream play lists, but I can't stream Prime Stations. The irony is that I can stream this stations on my wife's 2 years old Samsung and not on my new Fire Phone.I can't give 5 stars to an Amazon app that I can't use 100% on my Amazon phone.Juan J Guevara

title: If I have to use this app to get my ...
author: JASON P BAILEY
comments: If I have to use this app to get my purchased music, I will find somewhere else to get my music. PERIOD.

title: Great for the computer or ipad
author: Randall
comments: Great for the computer or ipad, but terrible for an android phone - almost useless.  The app will only use the phone's internal memory to store its data. It doesn't take long to completely use all internal storage.  Streaming works ok, as long as you have decent cell service (and unlimited data plan) or Wi-Fi.  Takes a lot of management - delete what you don't want to listen to today, download what you want to listen to before you head out - who has that much time?

title: One Star
author: J. Bomar
comments: Would not install.

title: A Good Deal
author: Belinda Bumble Bee
comments: I can download a ton of songs from an endless selection to my library and listen to them on my phone with the amazon app. Even though I have a Walkman I often plug my phone in and turn the speaker on so I can listen to all my songs as I move around the room with nothing to encumber my movements. I hesitated to pay the annual fee at first, but now that I have it I'm glad I decided to get it. Will undoubtedly renew my membership when it runs out!

title: Not compatible?
author: mrmikemrmike
comments: Why not?Amazon should invest in apps that are backwards compatible.No Amazon customer should have to buy a new phone to use the Amazon Music app.

title: Unable to save downloaded MP3s wherever you want.
author: D. Clark
comments: This app downloads MP3s to a directory called "Amazon Mp3" on the internal storage of your device.  Many Android devices these days, especially tablets, can take external expansion cards (eg microSDHC cards), and it is common for people to choose to store their media in external storage.  This app doesn't allow you to choose where you want to store your downloaded MP3s.

title: Stop profiling people
author: behe
comments: I wanted to listen to "the hills" by the weekend and it couldn't find it. It did bring up a different song by the weekend. So I did a search for G easy and it played one of his tracks I never heard before. Amazon, you have judged me to only to like what you want me to like! That's no way to make a profit.

title: The App constantly crashes and has a horrible user interface...
author: BB
comments: The app is extremely difficult to use.  It defaults to the local MP3's on your device.  Why in the hell would I launch the Amazon Prime app to listen to my own freaking MP3 files.  They make it extremely difficult to stream music.  Then, when you finally figure it out, the damn app crashes.  Amazon Prime is not worth the money.  I will be cancelling my trial before the 30 days.

title: wish I could with out buying two prime accounts
author: BT
comments: My husband loves it so I thought I would try it out, but because the account is under his name I am unable to log in on the same account. I think that it stupid for people who are married to have to have to pay for two prime accounts, that would be a waste of my money. I was really disappointed not to be able to try it out.

title: Bait and Switch
author: Someone
comments: I'm one of the thousands of people who trusted Amazon when they said they were offering "unlimited" free music storage on Cloud Player. Given the initial bugs with their service, it took me a lot of work and time, but I eventually got my music on Cloud Player. After a few months, Amazon changes it to 5 GB. After another few months, Amazon states that there will be a 250 song limit but that limit wouldn't count previously uploaded mp3s.  Fast forward to last week: I tried playing some of the songs that I uploaded when Cloud Player was first announced, and I found that all of my uploaded songs were gone. The only songs that remained were the music that I purchased from Amazon over the past few months. Today I find out that your previously uploaded songs don't count towards the Cloud Player limit because Amazon moved all of my uploads into Cloud Drive where I can't access those songs from Cloud Player which makes it useless. Like many other people I'm not willing to pay $25.00 just because Amazon is being dishonest due to poor planning. In the future they shouldn't promise to offer services forever that are not financially sustainable, just to gain a temporary edge over competitors like Google.I can honestly say that I've been a loyal Amazon customer over the years. However if this is a start of a new trend with Amazon I guess I'll be shopping around for a new favorite store to patronize.I'm also sure of another thing: I won't be buying music from Amazon in the future. Conversely, Google treats my music files fairly. and that's where I'm moving my future media purchases.

title: The Amazon MP3 app and music ecosystem is terrible. Does Amazon understand digital goods?
author: Ignatius Hsu
comments: The Amazon music listening and digital purchasing experience is characterized by one word, "horrific". Skip this app, save time, save the $24.99 annual fee, and use Google Music instead. Google Music is a competing cloud service free for up to 25,000 songs, and it just works. It's available from the Google Play storeThe Amazon MP3 app is buggy, clunky, looks dated and doesn't even offer genres for browsing through your library! Bluetooth cuts out frequently when I listen to songs through the app on my tablet. The app design says 2009 and it eschews the Android Holo design language for Amazon's awkward Kindle theme. The app starts you off on a screen where you have to select "Store" or "Player", and it doesn't seem to remember your preference, so you need to select "Player" each time you restart the app. That adds up to a lot of needless taps on your screen, which disrupts your listening experience. The app doesn't support genre browsing. You simply cannot use your music catalogue's genres. Don't bother with the Amazon MP3 app or Amazon's music ecosystem if you do any of the following: (1) purchase digital music (2) consume digital music (3) manage your music library (4) value your sensibilities as a consumer of music.The cloud service is clumsy to navigate is not truly Web based. You must supplement the Web based cloud player with several desktop apps to complete certain actions. The desktop downloader/uploader are equally as bad. Purchase songs and they're saved to the cloud and made available for free through Amazon Cloud Player. An ok start. Album art is 500px by 500px, also great.The rest of the Amazon MP3 experience is problematic. Album art from purchased songs is massive. A 700kb jpeg at 500px by 500px is gratuitous. Metadata is messy. Artists are not tagged correctly and Amazon makes no distinction between the Album Artist vs Artist metadata fields. Album titles have random words capitalized. Songs are inconsistently labeled. I need to re-tag the album metadata and update album art on my computer. So much for the phone app. Oh wait, you need to install a desktop app to download multiple MP3s, and you also need Adobe Air. And you need another desktop app to upload the updated songs. You also can't push updated songs from your desktop to the cloud (you need to make a list of each updated song, sign in to cloud player, delete each song, one by one from the cloud, then select each song from your desktop, and upload each song to the cloud. if you thought you could simply delete an album from the cloud and re-upload it, you're wrong.).Google Music offers a seamless purchasing and listening experience, is well integrated into Android, supports Genres and follows Android's design language. Google Music does this right. 25,000 songs uploaded to the cloud for free. Song management is almost perfect.The Google Music app starts up in the tab you last visited, so if you were in albums or artists, it picks up where you left off. You can purchase music, but consuming it is the heart of the app. Amazon's MP3 player emphasizes music purchases even though most of the app's users go to it to listen rather than shop for music. Songs I purchase from Google Play have tagged file metadata correctly (nice, Google!). Album art is perfect, Web optimized at 512px by 512px (close enough for me). The app has genre filtering and browsing. It allows you to randomize songs within a genre. The cover flow is very spiffy. I've invested time in getting my album art consistent so I could browse music visually as well as through metadata. I can see the effort bear fruit in this beautifully crafted app. The app uses the latest Android Holo design language, so looks consistent with the rest of the Android apps. It functions great and has a lock screen widget.Pushing updates from the desktop to the cloud is still a little challenging on Google Music, but nothing like the 80 steps per album Amazon experience. You can delete an album with two clicks. After that, it's 6 step process you complete once per batch of updates, whether it's an album or 100 albums. The cloud service is truly cloud based, and the user interface is elegant and intuitive. Like Amazon MP3, you need desktop software to upload music. Unlike Amazon MP3, in Google Play you can effortlessly download an entire album, delete it, or edit its metadata from the cloud, without the need for additional desktop software.The Amazon MP3 app is the opposite of Google Music. Go to Google Play, search for Google Music, and get started with an amazing music listening experience.

title: It WAS great -- before they began charging for it
author: GobiasIndustries
comments: I loved this app, it was great to download all my Amazon MP3's directly to my phone, or providing the ability to stream them if I didn't want them taking up memory. Now Amazon has decided to make users pay $25/year to have as much music on there as you want, or you can keep 250 (Amazon mp3's not withstanding) if you don't want to pay for it.It was my go-to music app, but I don't like restrictions on the music I put on my phone, and I sure as hell won't pay $25 a year to access the music I already paid for or uploaded to my cloud drive on their site. If I'm paying for the extra storage space through Amazon Prime, I should be able to do what I want with it.

title: Not Perfect but Better than the Sound of Silence
author: Hanala Sagal
comments: Echo often can't find the song unless it's worded in a specific way. Hope they improve it.

title: Hate it
author: J. Woody
comments: I can get past the horrible GUI but not it eating up over 45% of system resources everytime I launch it.  Brings down the whole system.  Bring back a simple web interface for uploading/downloading/managing instead of the windows app mess.

title: Please let users control where to download the music!
author: ULong
comments: Like many users out there, the only complain I have is that it's missing a simple function to be able to download music to external SD card.  I don't know why this cannot be implemented, is it due to some policy or what?  Without this function, this app will be short life, half useless.

title: Just started using...
author: P. Snyder
comments: I just started using Prime Music this past weekend, but it never asked me about installing a shortcut icon on my phone.  I have to go through the "long drawn out way" to access music...and then figure out how to find my playlist.  Seems weird to do it that way, so maybe I'll ask my son when I see him this weekend.

title: No Chromecast audio support -- No amazon fire TV stick support either.
author: John Galt
comments: Kinda pathetic that it can't cast music to Chromecast audio pucks, or even the Fire TV stick.Bluetooth is a pretty crappy way to connect to good speakers, and has all the problems of limited range, etc.If you use it for headphones only, it should be OK.  But it's not a solution for home audio.

title: Three Stars
author: MI User
comments: Meh - run-of-the-mil for a atreaming audio service. Nothing special. Similar to most others out there

title: Used to like it...
author: T. Meisinger
comments: I was really excited to download this app for my phone.  I previously had uploaded almost all of my music to the cloud.  So, when I got my new phone and the app, I was happy to have almost my entire music library at my fingertips.Then came August 1st...I am a Prime member, and I remember when I started using the cloud.  They said that songs would not count against my 5GB of free cloud storage.  In fact, the web page still says that.  However, when I went in to my cloud player on 08/01, I got a pop up message saying that I could only have 250 songs imported songs for free.  An imported song is anything you didn't purchase from Amazon (although that is not true because many of my imported songs are from CDs I did purchase from Amazon).So, I have until 08/31 to have all my imported songs on the cloud.  After that, I will need to pay for anything over 250 songs, and I have over 3,000.  It will be $24.99 per year, I believe is what the message said, to keep all my imported songs on there.  Now, just over $2 per month is not a lot of money, but when they tell you that you have 5GB of free storage and that "This space is yours to use as you like and you will never be charged for it." (that is quoted from their website) and then they change it on you, it leaves a bad taste.I have deleted all of my imported music from the cloud.  I have been a big supporter of Amazon and bragged about their cloud player and the benefits of Prime membership.  I have also touted the Kindle Fire.  I'm very disappointed with the way Amazon handled this.  I have uploaded all my songs now to Google Music (20,000 free with them) and will just use their player from now on.

title: the battery would run super hot, and nothing would work
author: Valerie LOBK
comments: This would mainly be something I would use in my car to stream music. I have plenty of favorites added to my music list on Amazon, and installed the app on my phone. Each time I tried to use this on my Samsung S2, the phone would freeze up, the battery would run super hot, and nothing would work. I would need to restart my phone to get anything working again. Tried this multiple times, never was able to get any song to play. Uninstalled.

title: Frozen on launch.
author: be the ball Danny
comments: Does not function at all. Frozen upon launch, and installed some bloatware: Amazon Music Help.exA surprisingly bad product from Amazon.

title: it is crap.
author: Steven Jones
comments: I installed this app after Amazon refused to allow me to download and of the music it offered me through Prime for free. Amazon said I had to have their app and a phone. I installed the app. It won't even take me to my playlist. It doesnt offer to play any music and won't acknowledge that such a thing as a playlist even exists. I uninstalled it 15 minutes after installing it. it is crap.

title: older was better
author: jameskoiman
comments: It was pretty good until they redesigned it now it is more complicated and the default homepage is prime music,I want my music to be the homepage and if i want to buy some more music than i will go there.The fact that the mp3's download to internal storage is really stupid!!!that is why we have sd cards ,so we don't hog up the internal memory,the app was more usable before!C'mon Amazon...listen to your customers for a change instead of trying to sell,sell,sell !

title: Doesn't Understand Classical Music
author: Bill
comments: You have no idea how classical music is performed.  You mix up movements as you think a movement is a song not a part of a whole piece of music.  You even play a section of a movement and jarringly cut to something totally out of character with what had just been played.  As is so with most sites you are totally focused on popular music.  Google is the only site that seems to get it mostly right.

title: MP3 on iPod Touch = FAIL!
author: Kendal
comments: Thought this would be a great app to have, since I've got several songs on my cloud drive. I used an AmazonLocal voucher to get three songs I wanted, Amazon had them, voucher = 3 for free! Sweet! Loaded from cloud to device no worries. Built a play list, success! Start driving and blasting tunes. iPod goes to autolock, player quits. Doesn't do this with iTunes player. No way in settings to keep playing when in sleep mode. So to keep music playing, I have to constantly fiddle with my iPod. But, I can't put it to the home screen, or it stops playing. I like to listen while working, but won't ever be able to listen to Amazon music cause the MP3 player is CRAP! CRAP CRAP CRAP! Worthless for a player that quits when the device screen goes dark. I've scoured the net for answers, and found no answers, but this same issue across multiple devices, including phones, tablets, etc.Can't believe this app was rushed with such a simple flaw NOT ADDRESSED!

title: Navigation is Difficult, Annoying
author: John
comments: It took quite a while to figure out how to navigate their menus and having to keep limiting the search to "prime only".  I get that it is a business and they're trying to steer me towards purchases, but that's what I'm not interested in.  I'll stick with my existing services.

title: All sorts of basics are missing. If you are ...
author: Dan B
comments: All sorts of basics are missing.  If you are creating a playlist 1) it doesn't warn you if you are putting in a song a second time 2) I can find no way to import a playlist from itunes 3) there is no way to sort the music in a playlist by, for example artist.  Its a near miss but the only reason to switch from itunes is free prime music.

title: Amazon music could not handle all of the existing music ...
author: Carl N
comments: Amazon music could not handle all of the existing music I already have and would marked them as corrupted music when I have no problem playing those on my iTune.

title: EVEN THOUGH IT IS USELESS!
author: Florine Francis
comments: Couldn't even get it to work, downloaded it to my android phone and it just could never connect to my Amazon Prime account.  I came on here and saw the reviews and wondered who the heck gave this app so many stars because most of the reviews were negative.  Now I cannot remove the damn thing from my phone, EVEN THOUGH IT IS USELESS!

title: Three Stars
author: Mr. A. Blake
comments: The app works fine. I'm disappointed with the selection of prime music, it's really small. Ive tried hunting for Christmas music and Christian music. Both have only a few albums and by artists I've not heard. When using other subscribe providers the collection available is much much better. Please add more albums to prime amazon!

It stores it all on internal in the data directory and never moves to SD card storage.  Why even have that option?  Oh, cuz people complained... don't you think they'd verify?

title: Five Stars
author: Marichu
comments: 10 stars!!!!!

title: False Advertising!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Prime membership does not give you any free music streaming! False Advertising!!! As if prime membership wasn't enough, they want you to pay another $96... I think I'll go elsewhere where I know what I'm getting!!

title: Useless Crap app for Useless Crap Phone.
author: Khend
comments: Don't bother with this piece of crap app for the Fire Phone... For that matter, don't bother with a Fire Phone... That is also completely useless.  This app offers the option to use a different account than the Fire Phone, but there apparently is no way to actually change the account... It just continues to the one that the Crap Fire Phone was registered under.

title: That is incredibly annoying. Please correct it
author: Amazon Customer
comments: This app appeared on my Amazon Fire TV device without request. It's been used once and seems to refuse to shut down. Any time another streaming app is paused, this app resumes playing.That is incredibly annoying. Please correct it.

title: Disaster!
author: Donald Jordan
comments: This is the most sluggish, hoggish app I have ever encountered. That is comes from my beloved Amazon only adds to the disappointment. Can I return to the far superior previous edition. This is a disgrace. Amazon should be ashamed.

title: Great music app
author: Maren
comments: I just upgraded my phone to the new Blackberry Priv which is powered by Android and therefore I finally have the Amazon music app. It was very easy and fast to download all my music I had purchased over the years through Amazon and can listen to it on my phone. Awesome app!! I love Amazon!

title: Crap
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Massive lack of content! I had Spotify before and there was never a track I couldnt find, now I'm impressed if I do find music! Gaps in content are horrendous! If you subscribe to a music service you expect it to meet all your needs!

title: It does do what it is supposed to and it ...
author: Thomas Myers
comments: It does do what it is supposed to and it does have the ability to download Prime or purchased audio for offline listening. A major improvement would be the ability to choose the path, or at least drive, that the music is being stored on. You cannot just move the files over to your external SDcard as you will get errors. Some have said that you can use a file manager to move purchased audio to an SDcard and it does check to see if their are in fact file on one.

title: amazon music is dysfunctional
author: Scott Elderkin
comments: continual conflict in instructions from different sources within amazon and amazon music.after fussing with it on several devices (not with my ipod touch though, the app is not compatible), I still can't figure out how to stream music or create playlists.I would pay $20/month to keep using Pandora rather than use amazon prime for free.

title: Cannot paste in password field
author: S. Law
comments: I am extremely disappointed that the newest version of this app no longer allows passwords to be pasted into the password field. Strong passwords (16+ characters, upper and lower case, numbers, other characters) are essential to account security. With the rising popularity of password managers, users should be able to paste their passwords into the password field.Please return paste functionality.

title: New ain't better!!!!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I hate your new app on play back. I can't transfer new music to my preferred player. Way to go. New differently isn't better. How can i get the old app back?????????

title: Almost 5 Star, Let's see SD card saving
author: George Weindel
comments: The library for Prime users and the newly added stations is awesome. It interfaces with my Ford's bluetooth seemlessly. It is the reason I haven't renewed satellite radio. Enable saving music to the SD card and this app is 5 star worthy.

title: Awesome Amazon
author: Eric
comments: Use this application to play songs on my samsung galaxy phone. Ordered CD copies from amazon and got free MP3 as well. They are stored in my amazon cloud which is also a nice feature.

title: Why make it so hard

comments: It hasn't crashed yet and it is responsive.  Those are the only two reason it gets two stars.  There is no way to exit.  It leaves a persistent notification that won't go away until the hit the 'x' around 10 times and back all the way out of the app.  Sometimes you can swipe the notification away only to have it come right back.  It only works in vertical orientation.  I was able to download prime music, but it took three times to get it to actually download.

title: Great tunes! When the application runs.
author: 7mmgal
comments: First off I would like to say that I love the music Amazon Prime gives me access to and the ability to make so many Playlist, and also the Playlist that prime provides using your genre of music. But, and it's the reason I will most likely not renew Amazon Prime this year, because free shipping and shopping does not make this app. worth $ 99.00 a year. But constantly being unable to listen to a full Playlist is a pain, and it's frustrating. Its not how long I'm listening to the music, because Prime music will stop after 5 minutes or stop every 20 minutes, and I get a notification saying Amazon Prime has stopped. Would you like to report or close program. I have reported it  many times, with no result. So my only other option is to go back to Google Music play. I'm very disappointed with Amazon Prime, I was so excited about the Prime Music, but now it's just frustrating to try to listen to music using Amazon Prime.  I'm writing this review in hopes that someone else has had this problem and found a way around it. Based on the music I would have given 5 stars, but the apps constant stopping rates it at 1 star.

I love that you can listen to me some or albums before you buy and you can download songs to your phone and listen offline! It does not allow you to specify where to store the songs on your Android device. They are stored on internal storage by default, which makes it virtually useless as a music app. Considering how easy it would be to fix and that I can find discussion threads about this going back two years = one star.

title: A cheap FM receiver is better. Don't forget that with data mining Amazon is ...
author: J. Steijn
comments: Playback tools are primitive, to say the least. Pause, unpause, rewind, skip and volume. That's it? A cheap FM receiver is better. Don't forget that with data mining Amazon is making money on every tune you play, regardless of whether you pay to download it.Amazon, you can do better.

title: A Must Have for All Music Aficinadoes
author: wilmofree
comments: Great Application - the music is great especially because you can download it to your own device.  Have it on two iOS devices and use it daily.  You can download or listen to your favorite music from just about any era.  My wife and I listen to good reading music at night when we are reading our Kindle Touches.  Highly recommend this to music lovers of all ages.  Great part of Amazon Prime.

title: Not ready for "Prime time"
author: Harry Piels
comments: At first I was optimistic that his would be a great find. Then reality sunk in. I think most customers want the original music that made the charts. Here, remakes seem to rule.( Oh I get it, the originals are mostly not free). It's often hard to weed out the (inferior) remakes by listening to one short sample. You can get caught with a bunch of lousy remakes you bought without knowing. Some artists seem to have remade almost every song and usually. they aren't close to the quality of the original hit song. Maybe that's why the popular music scene is suffering compared with earlier times: don't bite the hand that feeds you.. I also noticed songs being added to my playlist that I didn't want. Don't know why, but annoying. They also kept throwing albums and choices out that  weren't even close to my preferences.Many searches for songs that were in the top twenty found no hits at all.. I hope this improves. It's a great idea.,to have music as a benefit .and I did get a few playlists together with the (original) music I love, but at a cost...

title: Some technical improvements would make it better
author: Tristan
comments: I generally like Amazon Music. There a few issues : some of the classical recordings are not the most recent, many are in MONO but they are still good performances. It's annoying if there are sections of the recording missing. Also, if it's a very long band (over 40 minutes) and you pause it, you are not always able to go back to the point that you left off. It would be better if you were allowed to skip ahead.

title: One Star
author: Sid
comments: App still won't run on my PC after your "update"...please fix this...

title: UI kind of sucks but the worst part is that a lot of ...
author: cole horsman
comments: UI kind of sucks but the worst part is that a lot of popular songs are excluded from prime music but the rest of the album is available? I'm slowly realizing that Prime is starting to not be worth the pricetag.

title: Amazing product.
author: Felipe
comments: I am a Prime users strictly for the shipping.I have always appreciated the extra "free" services but never used them.I use Netflix for video streaming and Pandora for music streaming.I have been using Amazon music with Prime for the last 2 weeks and this service is amazing.I would pay for it by itself. I enjoy it more than Pandora.

title: new version with free Prime not functional
author: T. Bill
comments: Spent over 20 minutes with your help desk trying to get the new version to load with the 3 white lines in upper left corner so I could get free music since I am a Prime member. Downloaded, did not work; uninstalled and tried again. WTF? Old version or new; either should work. Turns out you must have Android 4 or better on your device. My Samsung is 2 yrs old and will not work with Prime Music app. Thanks for nothing Amazon!!

title: No Technical Support
author: Ben
comments: Since the new update it doesn't work. They don't answer the forums.

title: Prime Music rocks
author: Rudy Jr
comments: Has a lot of great music to listen on any device. I have it on my work iPhone, my droid personal phone, a droid tablet and 2 pcs. Every week there is new music to check out and I lcan download my favorites on my mobile devices. Even has new releases in the genre that I listen to... Metal!My only complaint is that the cloud storage for my personal library is limited, only allowing me to get a fraction  of my own music collection uploaded. I would like to have it all in one place instead of having it split up with another cloud service. All in all, one of the main reasons I joined Amazon prime and it has been worth it.

title: Amazon's own MP3 files don't work in Amazon Music app
author: GregK
comments: Android app used to work great, then one day it started getting a Playback Error suggesting that the downloaded Amazon mp3's were corrupt or an unsupported format (Exception #171). Very strange since these are Amazon's own mp3's. Even more odd, the mp3's are all playable using Google Play!

title: taking back your android.
author: moto
comments: i had the same problem with my new lg, no enternal space. 1st i turned off every application, even android. 2nd i got a 16g sd card, plugged my lg into cloud, made a huge play list with mixed music media, jazz classical, oldies, rock,opera, new stuff GAGA, rahanna everything. apps like bluetooth and others i turned back on google and other junk stays off. once you get your playlist in, place your device on shuffle, and walla! i have 32gigs of music not measured in hours but days.

title: I like it...Though I didn't know it could be purchased this logo
author: Dexter farlough
comments: I didn't order this, because I already have it with the service. And, Ive had to old amazon prime music since 2014 or 2015. Because, I've purchased music from amazon with respect to my auto-zip, mp3, and purchases  I love it, it's only been a few months almost since I noticed the new logo here. Somehow I accidentally hit the wrong button. Oops!

title: impossible to understand why when I buy music I'm not ...
author: Evie R Taller
comments: impossible to understand why when I buy music I'm not able to control it... take your hands off! The first supplier to completely allow users to have control of their music will have my vote.

title: Once the only reason for hope, now hope begins to fade
author: G. Lloyd
comments: I used to be able to play my amazon music on my samsung TV but alas, the app has been removed. I guess I have to find another way to get my amazon music on the speakers running through my TV. Thanks guys.

title: 3 so that apps performance is amazing no memory issues however why pay for access to ...
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I'm Making this review via Amazon Fire phone FireIOS 4.6.3 so that apps performance is amazing no memory issues however why pay for access to stale music that could be streamed on hundreds of sites for free so I've decided not to renew Prime next year Why are They're 2 Amazon apps that do the same thing on my device anyway?

title: I'm almost tempted to use this instead of iTunes, ...
author: Joey Mars
comments: I'm almost tempted to use this instead of iTunes, you know, if I could actually download my music. Though my music shows up in my browser, regardless of the actions I take after I cannot download to my computer.

title: Useless without external storage option!
author: Insanelycool
comments: I want to like it, but this app is entirely useless without the ability to store the cache and files on external SD. Might as well pay for google play music so that you can have a choice to store files and streaming cache externally. Internal space is limited, and unless this gets an option to store on EXTERNAL SD card, it will remain 1 star. Would be happy to give it 5 stars otherwise. Fix this Amazon! Make this app worth actually having!

title: Prime Stations Suck!
author: Daniel
comments: The music selection is awful and sub par.It has a fraction good streamable songs, the "top songs" might hit 3 songs on the top 40 and that is about it.The stations are repetitive and pull from a small sample of songs so through-out a couple hour listening time all the songs seem to be exhausted and begin to repeat.

title: Android App lags with large music library
author: G. Kohtz
comments: Currently, my Amazon Cloud Player library contains 22,884 songs.  I love using the web-based Cloud Player on my pc to listen to music while at work.  Unfortunately, with the amount of music I have, the Android App (HTC EVO 4G) becomes very slow and crashes frequently.  I think problems are caused because the app is trying to locally cache my music library's index, so the app knows what music is available to stream from the Cloud Player's server.  The AmazonMP3 App's Data usage grows to just over 54MB after downloading the "index".  And that data stays on Android's internal memory, also causing space shortages on my phone.Once playing music, the app does a good job.  Rarely do I hear skips during a song, even while streaming over 3G connections, and song playback starts within reasonable time of hitting play.I would like to see Amazon refine the the AmazonMP3 App to work more efficiently with larger Cloud Player libraries.  Then it would become THE cloud-based player for me.

title: NO stars for you except the I have to give you
author: sam rutherford
comments: This has become ridiculously difficult. I chose a huge group of music and got five song. Which I bought. I have a useless prime account. If this continues I am throwing my hands up in the air and quitting.Big waist of a day I can never get back. Something has gone haywire with your so called prime music which is why I use you.

title: One Star
author: Paige Nelson
comments: I don't like Amazon Music.

title: What Happened?
author: Jazzchiq
comments: This WAS a five-star app until a recent update.  Now all I get is the Welcome Screen.  There are 2 options: Explore Prime Music and Go To Your Library.  Neither option works, and I am stuck with a welcome screen.  I uninstalled/reinstalled the app, but to no avail.  This now makes 2 Amazon apps which are no longer functional on Android (Instant Video being the other one).  Makes me rethink my subscription.

title: Greedy company
author: Mark LaFrance
comments: Thought it was free with my prime subscription.  However you have a very limited selection unless you pay even more money. No thanks...ill stick with Google play music. If im going to have to pay ill stay with what I already have.

title: Love the Cloud Drive idea and Player, but the app sucks for the Atrix
author: Sally
comments: I jumped all over the opportunity to access my music from my home computer anywhere, as much as I love Pandora and Slacker I actually like the music in my personal library. I hate the load/reload convert drama going from different MP3 players, so I thought that I would be in music heaven with the Android app. NOT so much. There are way too many issues with buffering for me (I have a Motorola Atrix) and most times when I have tried to use the app I have been in 4G or on Wi-Fi. I like being able to access the cloud player via internet, but I really wanted to have access to my library through my phone, and just have that device as my MP3 player. I'm hoping that future fixes may address the problem.

title: but this new app is horrible. Cannot get it to not crash within 5 ...
author: Mike Beard
comments: I've always been an Amazon fan, but this new app is horrible. Cannot get it to not crash within 5 seconds of running. This is unacceptable, will not buy a single thing from Amazon till they fix this!

title: Five Stars
author: Paul
comments: Delivered on time, awesome

title: Prime family membership
author: margaux
comments: I added my wife to my prime account, but have been unable to register her fire tablet.

title: BAIT AND SWITCH RIPP OFF
author: Don
comments: A large portion of your songs will be greyed out and not available , even though other customers still have access to the exact same songs. Then they will refer you to their  Music purchasing site .

title: Must have
author: Susan Hillard
comments: When I bought the blue tooth receiver for the car, I lost my tunes until I put prime music on my phone. Because you have to tune the radio to an empty fm station you lose the music that comes from that radio. But thru Prime music, I can listen to my music and take my calls hands free.

title: Flashing album art
author: Mark Shuttleworth
comments: New version is crap.  My song list shows album art ... They disappear a second later replaced by loading ... Than reappear a sec later.  This repeats every 2 seconds.  Very annoying.

title: Needs to improve
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I have issues with it constantly. On my computer it will not play no matter where I am connected at home or in the office. It just tries to keep loading the songs but never plays. My app works fine

title: Limited Music Choices, however free and ad free. ...
author: CiT
comments: Limited Music Choices, however free and ad free.Android issue when leaving a wifi or 4g area such as nyc train or PATH.you can't even listen to your downloaded music as something fails.

title: So much for having to quit buying CD's
author: VITSOL
comments: I have invested a small fortune in CD's over the past 25 years, so I had no need to download MP3 files. I would simply rip only the best songs from my CD collection to be transferred to the Ipod in my car. Back when I had dial-up internet, I actually downloaded a few MP3 songs, which took 20 minutes each. I went back to purchasing CD's after that. Now that I have super high speed interenet at home, I figured that I could easily download the 2-3 good songs from an album instead of buying the whole CD. No way, thanks to something called the Cloud Player. Let me get this straight! If I purchase MP3 songs from Amazon, I am not even allowed to keep them on the hard drive of my desk top PC, which I now also use as a home juke box fed into my home stereo system. It now also seems like everyone assumes that everyone else has a smart phone and listens to music through ear buds. Well I DON'T! I listen to all of my MP3 files through 240 watts in my car or at home. I could not even find a way to contact Amazon to see if I am wrong, but from reading all of these negative reviews, it appears to be worse. Big Brother has now found a way to know your every move so all kinds of crap can be advertised to you without invitation. It looks like when CD's quit being made, my music buying days are over with. By the way, I have never had to download anything on iTunes, and it appears that they also have similar restrictions, but not quite as bad. Can anyone correct me if I am wrong?

title: It's good, but could be better.
author: PhotoMommy
comments: Random play still needs to be actually random. If I hit play from the first song on a playlist, the random set is always the same. Not cool. Also, opening the app never works the same way twice. Sometimes, I'm back where I left off and sometimes I'm at the beginning of the app with none of what I was last playing in sight.

title: Wasn't broken until they fixed it.
author: Alexander VanArsdall
comments: This was my music app of choice until recently.  There has been a recent update to the software that kills a lot of the user friendly functionality.  The app doesn't remember where you left off in your play list (or that you were using one in the first place), forces you to set the shuffle and repeat functions on every time you open it, etc.  It's obvious that the app is meant to help you buy music, rather than enjoy it.

title: Hate IT!!!
author: Susie Trevors
comments: I don't want to use the cloud.  I have my own cloud.  This app gives you no option to send you PURCHASED music any place other than their stupid cloud.  To transfer it to another device requires a convoluted, laborious process that is different every time I buy something.  This is the reason I don't use I tunes any longer.

title: New app sucks!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: The new app is horrible! When I search for new music all I get is Gospel or African Tribal, which I'm sure are wonderful genresummer, but I'm not interested in either. I want to buy music from you! Fix it!

title: Streaming fail
author: Seth C. Martin
comments: I can't stream more than a song or two before it randomly stops playing in the middle of a song.  Persistent problem across two phones for several years. Get it together amazon.

title: OS X keyboard integration
author: T. Conant
comments: I'm writing this review purely to praise the OS X keyboard integration with the music navigation keys. I use the app for prime music station streaming.  In comparison to the Pandora desktop app where they didn't take the time for those details in their desktop player.

title: Too complex by far. Why can't playlist and downloads ...
author: David George
comments: Too complex by far.  Why can't playlist and downloads to mp3 be simple, direct, labeled?  Is it too much to ask.  Too many electronic products are written by geeks for geeks and no by users.

title: Thought I was going to love this app!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I loved this app until I realized I can't make the Playlist I wanted. Can't even find The Chronic and have added some Warren G songs to a Playlist 5+ times and they still aren't there...Guess it's back to Spotify!

title: What A Waste
author: Kristopher Matthew Graham
comments: I'm about to cancel my prime membership.  I lose music that use to be included and now the app has stopped working.

title: Hate this now and will take it off my computer
author: pmom1226
comments: Unlike others I had never had problems with this app UNTIL the recent update. Hate this now and will take it off my computer. Hard to tell what has already been downloaded and very confusing.

title: Cant share misic app
author: Big-O
comments: So i cant share this music app with my family. I need to pay aditional fees for family unlimited music. This sucks i will have to go back to spotify and cancel Prime membership

title: Good beats, decent selection, no complaints
author: Dchon
comments: Prime music is great. Especially if your phone has unlimited data. Then you can listen to your heart's content while working out or in the office. The user interface isn't the best, but if you tap around and search you should be able to find a station to your liking. I really can't complain when this is just another one of the many features of Prime and there are no commercials.

title: Needs to allow music to fade or pause while map ...
author: James Cotsonas
comments: Needs to allow music to fade or pause while map apps are talking.  I cannot listen to music and pay attention to directions when they are fighting to speak.

title: WILL  NOT WORK

comments: THIS APP WILL NOT DOWNLOAD! I pay for prime and can't even use IT!!! I have a newer version of the kindle fire and it still won't work. Prime Music would be nice considering I got an ALL NEW kindle because it wouldn't work the first time! Get with it Amazon!!

title: Five Stars
author: Natalie Cihan
comments: no commercials with prime!!

title: Gets worse with every update
author: Jack Mazzotti
comments: Designed by an completely incompetent ignoramus. Gets worse with every update. It stalls, can't download properly, too many menus, cant just click on an album, forgets where you left off, always wants to shuffle like only an idiot want to do

title: I am constantly amazed at the value that comes with a prime membership
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I dig it. Didn't even realize this existed.  I am constantly amazed at the value that comes with a prime membership. Yes, I wish there was more music, but man, I do prime just for the free shipping, everything else is a bonus. And this is a huge bonus.

title: Doesn't work well through my firewall...
author: esimpson1
comments: If I connect directly to my FiOS Wireless router, I seem to have no problems.  Virtually everything else (including 2 hotspots) are forced to go through my firewall.  If I connect to the Cell network, I have no problems.I can't seem to find any indication that I should open any ports in my firewall to allow the MP3 app to work.  Very frustrating because I definitely like the app (when it used to work with no problems).  When I go into the App and say, try to load the most popular songs -- it just hangs with a circule spinning indicating it's waiting for the list to be delivered.Anyone have any thoughts?

title: Good concept ruined by terrible implementation
author: trickdick
comments: Make no mistake the amazon mp3 cloud is an attractive concept. But the current implementation is woeful. Lack of functionality means that the 'player' simply serves a (useful) role as a downloader from the amazon cloud. But given the lack of ability to direct downloads to the external sd card, you may as well not bother with this app. Shameful on Amazon that they *could* make this so good, so useful and so popular, but instead have chosen(?) to implement so badly.

title: Poor versions of the songs
author: Joe H.
comments: Most of the songs I have downloaded are not sung by the original artist or when the song is sung by the original artist, it is a remade version from the songs we know and love. Very disappointing.

title: Disappointing and ''feature'' rich.
author: William S. Frisbee
comments: Tried to purchase an album, it gave me the choice to transfer it to my cloud drive, I said yes, it said error and now I cannot download my album to my cloud drive or computer.  It has been almost two days and I have yet to get a response from support or find some way of getting the album I paid for. Not the first time something like this has happened to me on Amazon with the MP3 downloads.Major Fail.  I think I'll have to buy music elsewhere and play it on more stable platforms.

title: Music Review
author: John
comments: Difficult to use.

title: I love being a PRIME member as it gives me access ...

comments: I love being a PRIME member as it gives me access to wonderful healing music like Aeoliah, Liquid Mind, Baroque, etc. I love the selections on here. Sometimes when I don't find a good movie on Prime, I just stream the music and it so relaxing and healing.

title: keep trying to extort $$
author: Pbone
comments: Not what I thought. Spend more. And more. The basic service kinda sux and I aint paying for extra. $99 a year is considerable money to spend on mediocre products. S P O T I F Y!

comments: Compared to most music services this is a downgrade. Makes exploring new music in certain genres very difficult. A prime (har har) example is Dance & Electronic where everything is lumped into one. Sorry, but there's over a hundreds sub-genres of Electronic (let alone Dance) to just clump it together. Perhaps when Amazing becomes serious about music other people will take it more seriously as well.

title: love the app but need to fix the inability to download to external SD

comments: I love almost everything about this app. All kinds Of music (which a bit of is for free), but not everything. Plays music that wasn't from the player, but again everything. But the biggest problem I have with the app is that you can't change the download path, or download to your external SD card, so all of your internal memory is loaded up with all your music.Will rate higher of fixed

title: Cloud player on apple, finally!

Some Chinese title songs had random code for artist or title name when uploaded . Cloud drive also distinguish between lower and upper case letters! Fix these!2. Please accept apple lossless format somehow! I know there might be some legal issue, but one way is to convert it to amazon format when upload, with user confirmation of course.Looking forward to more use of cloud drive and cloud player!!!

title: My phones store would soon be full if I purchased all the music I'd like. I have a 64GB sd card installed that ...

title: Small selection

comments: I was using this fine on my Mac, then it quit working like so many other people have said.  I have contacted Amazon support, they have no idea what's going on.  Totally useless.

title: Doesnt work
author: Eric
comments: With the prime video and music apps update, now they wont even play or open.  This is bull and im pissed.  Im not going to pay for membership or use amazon if its like this.

comments: I LOVE this feature! One more reason why Amazon  IS AMAZON! I'm not an 'APPLE ' drone- years of ipod music regulations have been frustrating, I am thrilled with finally having  a viable -MUCH BETTER- alternative is music to my ears! no pun intended _Ù÷
